programme.desc: Chemotherapy is taking its toll on Connie, but she remains determined to fly to America to spend Christmas with Grace. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: PC Young acts as bait to catch a flasher terrorising Sun Hill, and an eyewitness to the armed robbery comes forward, bringing CID a step closer to finding the gang responsible. programme.title: The Bill

programme.desc: First in a two-part drama, starring Billie Whitelaw as a herbalist who takes an 11-year-old orphan under her wing. programme.desc: Jenny is seconded to a short-staffed hospital in London, but grows increasingly reluctant to carry out her duties when she finds out she is working under intimidating surgeon Mr Tracey. programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Satirist, presenter and producer Munya Chawawa, comedian Bob Mortimer, Professor Alice Roberts and radio presenter Snoochie Shy join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden aims to bring a slice of Hollywood to Sicily with a banana leaf-patterned boudoir as she takes the reins designing the master bedroom. Alan Carr is concerned her camp theme is on the wrong side of tacky, so she takes him to visit one of Palermo's most prestigious hotels to show how exuberant décor has enticed high-profile guests including famous composer Richard Wagner. To bring her vision to life, Amanda ropes in her DIY-loving father to help build a bespoke four-poster bed. Alan, meanwhile, learns to kick back like the Italians do, with a lesson in the art of doing nothing

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Neville receives an anonymous letter telling them a murder is about to be committed. Not long after, he and Naomi are called to the harbour when a body is pulled from the ocean. The victim suffered blunt trauma and it is soon suggested that his disgruntled wife may be a person of interest. Marlon returns after taking a short holiday following his disappointing exam results. Sun-kissed detective drama, starring Ralf Little, Don Warrington and Ginny Holder

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Scotland v Wales (Kick-off 4.45pm). Gabby Logan presents all the action from the match in the second round of fixtures, held at BT Murrayfield. Wales prevailed 20-17 when the sides met at Principality Stadium last year thanks to Dan Biggar's drop goal 11 minutes from time. However, that proved to be their only win of the campaign, and victories over England and Italy ensured Scotland finished one place above them in the table in fourth. With analysis from Martin Johnson, John Barclay and Jonathan Davies, and commentary by Andrew Cotter, Chris Paterson and Sam Warburton

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Ashok drives the wrong way up a motorway and crashes his vehicle into a young couple. While he fears about his papers, Rash - remorseful for the actions of his father - insists he wants to treat one of the injured passengers, who he thinks may be suffering from spinal shock. Marcus drives a wedge between Stevie and her champion Faith, while Paul accidentally reveals a large cut on his arm to a horrified Robyn and admits he sustained it while on shift for Damien

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jacob encounters a fellow jogger who has been trapped between rocks for three days. Unable to raise an alarm due to the remoteness of the location, he has to contemplate performing an amputation then and there. His heroic act impresses Marcus to the extent that he is prepared to work with Jacob in addressing the problem of a skeleton staff in ED. Marcus warns Dylan to drop the care home patients issue, but his obsession risks him losing his job. Paige accidentally falls asleep in the staff room and it seems clear her work is suffering as a result of helping Rash

programme.title: Not Going Out

Plus, Crystal Palace v Brighton & Hove Albion, Fulham v Nottingham Forest, Leicester City v Tottenham Hotspur, Southampton v Wolverhampton Wanderers and Bournemouth v Newcastle United

programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Holly Hamilton present topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The team reports on three sets of developers taking on three very different auction properties in London and Wolverhampton, with hammer prices ranging from just over £100,000 to nearly half a million. Time will tell whether all three investors will deliver stunning renovations

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp hosts from Southwell Racecourse in Nottinghamshire, where experts Thomas Forrester and Tim Weeks help competing teams bag the best buys to make a profit at auction. Natasha also investigates a mystery item that dates back to the mid-19th century

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Claire McCollum marks Valentine's Day by discovering the extraordinary 275-year history of love and marriage at Gretna Green, from young lovers eloping in the 18th century through to the 3,000-plus couples who still get married in the tiny border village each year. Claire also meets the parents who made history as the first same-sex couple in Scotland to be approved for adoption

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah showcases a selection of Cotswolds properties to a couple from Essex who are hoping their budget of £550,000 will buy them a new home with three bedrooms, one of which could be used for a home office

programme.title: Chicken Run (2000)
programme.desc: A headstrong chicken and her fellow fowls ponder how to escape from a grim Yorkshire farm before the evil farmer's wife can turn them into pies. Luckily, help arrives in the form of a heroic American rooster who promises to show them how to fly. Nick Park's animated comedy, with the voices of Mel Gibson, Julia Sawalha, Miranda Richardson and Jane Horrocks

programme.title: Young MasterChef
programme.desc: The contestants must work in pairs to dash around the supermarket and cook a feast on a budget of £30. Their dish must be all their own, but they must design a menu in their pairs

programme.title: Young MasterChef
programme.desc: The Young MasterChef final five are back to show judges Poppy and Kerth their sweet side in the form of an ice cream parlour challenge

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: Bakari and the rest of the baboons can see no escape when the lions take over their home - until the pride fall asleep. Baby hippo Mafuta's mother tries to keep the crocodiles from desecrating his dead father's body - but in the ensuing chaos the youngster is swept away down the river. Crocodile Magamba defends her hatchlings and Duma the cheetah struggles to make friends

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Steve Brown head to the North Yorkshire coast and the beautiful village of Staithes to find out how the traditional fishing community is adapting for the future. Where once there was a fishing fleet of 80, now there is just one fishermen left. Joe also goes out to sea to discover how one skipper has swapped nets for wildlife tourism, while Steve takes a look at Staithes' art heritage and tastes some locally-smoked goodies. Adam Henson finds out about the challenges facing a sheep dairy and Charlotte Smith investigates the latest developments behind one of Britain's biggest ecological marine disasters

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The Roadshow travels to Portchester Castle in Hampshire, where treasures include an extraordinary set of RAF medals, awarded for extreme bravery to an airman who served in Dunkirk and the Battle of Britain. The team also admires some rare punk clothing by fashion designer Vivienne Westwood and a roll of ornate Arts and Crafts wallpaper destined for the bonfire. Amin Jaffer appraises two valuable paintings by prominent 20th-century Indian artists, Jamini Roy and KH Ara, and explains how each man expressed ideas of Indian identity and nationhood in their works

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Everyone is looking forward to Trixie and Matthew's wedding and a bonny baby competition brings the community together. It's not all good news, however, as the team learn about a pregnant woman and her family living in a cramped caravan, while a worrying disease outbreak directly impacts the residents of Nonnatus House

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: Crime drama inspired by the true story of the 1983 Brink's-Mat gold robbery, telling the story from the point of view of both the police and the criminals. When £26million worth of gold is stolen from the Brink's-Mat security depot near Heathrow Airport, long-serving DCI Brian Boyce arrives from counter-terrorism and sets up a task force to investigate. Meanwhile, robbery ringleader Micky McAvoy tries to dispose of the bullion. Starring Hugh Bonneville, Dominic Cooper and Charlotte Spencer

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Leeds United v Manchester United at Elland Road and Manchester City v Aston Villa at the Etihad Stadium. City were looking to maintain the pressure on Arsenal at the top of the table, while the two Uniteds met for the second time in five days. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the weekend's games in the Super League, including Manchester City v Arsenal and Tottenham Hotspur v Manchester United

programme.title: Before I Go to Sleep (2014)
programme.desc: A woman who cannot retain her memories following a traumatic accident is contacted by a mysterious neuropsychologist, who offers to help her recover the truth about her condition. As she tries to piece together the events of her past, she begins to fear neither her husband nor the doctor are who they seem to be. Thriller, starring Nicole Kidman, Colin Firth and Mark Strong

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Tommy Walsh and Martel Maxwell explore properties about to be auctioned in Sheffield, Llanelli in Carmarthenshire and Boston in southern Lincolnshire. Martin, Dion and Tommy meet the new owners and hear their plans to make some money

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Work colleagues and friends Mel, Alice, Julie and Audra compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the great fire, the animals struggle to survive in an unrecognisable and inhospitable land. Bakari the baboon discovers his rival has perished in the blaze - but this does little to calm the tensions among the troop. Kali the lioness found refuge in a cave, but now she and her cubs are trapped there while her sister gives birth. They are separated from the pride with nothing to eat and no one to defend them

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics UK
programme.desc: The week's political proceedings around the UK

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Ore Oduba in which contestants have to answer questions to get as far along a track as they can before a ball catches and passes them, ending their go

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Britain in Bloom
programme.desc: Chris Bavin heads to the historic market town of Oakham in Rutland, where the Bloomers have to cope with major roadworks if they are to complete their project

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Helen Flanagan and Jorgie Porter scour some of Scotland's finest antique shops in the hope of finding items that will make the biggest profit at auction in Stirlingshire. Jorgie takes a detour to hit an ace at on a very historic tennis court, while Helen takes a break from the shops to learn about tartan and kilts. Experts Philip Serrell and James Braxton try to keep the duo on the straight and narrow

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Simon Parfett and the team travel to Hampshire this week to join Kerie and Dave on their land on the border of the South Downs National Park. Nestled in this picturesque woodland lies an old shepherd's hut and pigsty which Kerie and Dave dream of renovating in to a B&B business. Simon and the team help turn these abandoned dwellings in to an enchanting holiday destination by converting a pigsty into a quirky bunkhouse, revamping the shepherd's hut, and building a spacious outdoor kitchen fitted with one-of-a-kind riding saddle seats

programme.title: Coast and Country Auctions
programme.desc: A visit to Exeter Livestock Market, the biggest agricultural auction in the region, where a team of auctioneers can sell more than 3,000 animals in about four hours

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Antique experts Caroline Hawley and Nick Hall are on hand at the City Hall in Hull, hoping to find a selection of objects to take to auction. Caroline is delighted to find a painting by local artist Steven Dews and Nick is bedazzled by some iconic 1970s jewellery. Presenter Paul Martin visits the Wilberforce House Museum in Hull's Old Town to hear the story of Hull-born William Wilberforce, the great anti-slave trade campaigner

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Kae Kurd, Zoe Lyons, Andrew Hunter Murray and Kate Robbins go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games for the final time, prior to the week's overall winner being declared

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: The actor is joined by Hairy Biker Si King on his quest to find new ways of spending time in the great outdoors. Taking the scenic route north to Chillingham, the pair head out to visit the Estate's famous wild cattle

programme.title: Cornwall with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which the explorer travels through Cornwall as its emerges from the first lockdown, discovering the impact of Covid-19 on a part of the country highly reliant on tourism. Simon discovers the ongoing impact of the collapse of the tin-mining industry in the 1980s when he visits one of Britain's poorest estates, and meets the entrepreneurs who sell homemade food on the beach who are struggling to make enough money to last the winter

programme.title: Your Garden Made Perfect
programme.desc: Mandy and Chris adore their Victorian home in Manchester, but they cannot unlock the potential of their garden. Overlooked on all sides, the couple feel exposed whenever they spend time in it. Providing inspiration for the area are designers Helen Elks-Smith and Pip Probert. Meanwhile, Joel Bird meets Ben and Elaine, a Wiltshire couple who have an unusual outdoor space. Angela Scanlon hosts

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition of the comedy panel game in which Sandi Toksvig takes a look at tubes and tubas. The panellists are Bridget Christie, Sara Pascoe, Deborah Frances White and series regular Alan Davies

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Host Tez Ilyas welcomes Spring Day and Ignacio Lopez to the stage at London's Hammersmith Apollo where they each offer their unique views of life

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Faisal Islam

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Memento (2000)
programme.desc: An insurance investigator suffers from short-term memory loss after an attack in which his wife was also raped and murdered. Unable to remember events for more than a few minutes, he is determined to track down the killer and relies on copious note-taking and reminders tattooed on his body to aid his mission. Christopher Nolan's thriller, starring Guy Pearce, Carrie-Anne Moss, Joe Pantoliano and Mark Boone Jr

programme.title: The Shamima Begum Story
programme.desc: At 15, Shamima Begum left London to join the terror group Islamic State. It made global headlines. Four years later, pregnant with her third child, Begum emerged from the ashes of the so-called caliphate, desperate to come home. But she showed little remorse for her time with the group. For the first time, she's given her account of what happened since 2014 to investigative journalist Josh Baker

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The cloud is hugely popular. It stores people's pictures and emails, it powers internet searches and it helps stream movies and box sets. But out of sight, the cloud depends on processing factories - vast data centres that use enormous amounts of power and water. Every time someone goes online, they increase its carbon footprint. Richard Bilton investigates the growing environmental problem for which everyone is responsible

programme.title: Marie Antoinette
programme.desc: The king collapses, and on recovery, decides to grant du Barry status at court - as his queen. An official visit to Paris puts Louis and Antoinette on show. Drama, starring Emilia Schüle and Louis Cunningham

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.desc: A feverish Stede flashes back to scenes of his marriage, while Blackbeard experiences an identity crisis. Jim fields awkward questions from the over-curious crew, and with the Spanish approaching, the two captains must each walk a mile in the other's shoes. Pirate comedy, starring Rhys Darby and Taika Waititi

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Energetic animation for children aged two to five, following Duggee the dog and his Squirrel Club

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels have just got some new walkie-talkies and are having so much fun with them. Duggee calls the Squirrels to come for some blueberry juice, but as Tag is running, he trips over a car and falls through a secret door in the wall! Communicating through his walkie-talkie, Tag doesn't know where he is. He can see lots and lots of things around him, but no-one has any idea where this room is in the house. As Duggee listens to Tag describe what's in the room, he realises that Tag must be in the lost property room. But Duggee doesn't know where in the house that is. He's going to need to go find the map of the house which he has hidden somewhere. Whilst Tag explores all the treasures of the lost property room, the Squirrels search for hints to where the map could be around the Clubhouse. Finally, after looking all over the house, Betty finds the code on a piece of paper, opens the safe and gets the map. Tag has been entertaining himself dancing with a lion statue and playing a churc

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Can Shaun restore order in the newly opened petting zoo?

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Dennis and his mates rebel against an outbreak of unfair fun-killing rules that are being imposed on Beanotown.

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: The kids hold a yard sale but decide they really don't want to sell their stuff

programme.title: The Football Academy
programme.desc: Enter the fun world of a football-mad family, where life is never quiet, and meet para-footballer Ellie as she travels to the Women's Euros.

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: Duncan from Glasgow is passionate about protecting orangutans and wants to raise awareness of their plight within his local community. He wants a den where he can hang out, learn more about his favourite primates and how to help them, and share his passion with friends.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors investigate which part of the body heals the fastest

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Mwaksy gets a tour of the RRS Sir David Attenborough before its voyage to Antarctica

programme.title: Deadly Pole to Pole
programme.desc: Steve Backshall travels to the remote and wild Falkland Islands, where he meets the pugnacious and tough rockhopper penguin

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: As the land recovers the action now centres on the river, where the bonds of kinship are tested to their limits. Kali the lioness is separated from her cubs in a spectacular hunt and the baby lions find themselves trapped in a bend in a river, with hooves thundering all around them. Chubby baby hippo Mafuta learns to survive in his riverine home, although just staying afloat is a challenge for this newborn - and Magamba the crocodile also has him in her sights

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey helps the Viney family declutter their home after grandma Sue filled their house with her deceased mum's belongings and the contents of a recently closed gift shop. Sue's children are desperate for a clear out so they can come over and spend more time with her. The team remove everything from the house including 532 plastic carrier bags, 205 hair rollers, 30 umbrellas, 17 digital cameras and 443 pairs of shoes. While the family sort through what they want to keep, recycle, donate or sell, carpenter Rob installs a pulldown bed for extra space and Dilly reinstates the downstairs as a functioning living and dining space

programme.title: A Cook Abroad
programme.desc: The cook and food writer goes on a culinary tour of the Southeast Asian country. She begins in the capital Kuala Lumpur, gaining her first insights into Malaysian food and culture from family members she hasn't seen since childhood. Rachel then meets cooks and students at her father's old school and begins to find out why Malaysian food is so complex, before she heads to Penang, the food capital of the country, and discovers why Malaysia is a great place to be young, female and Muslim

programme.title: Now, Voyager (1942)
programme.desc: A nervous and frustrated spinster undergoes psychiatric treatment and emerges transformed. Despite her new-found happiness and optimistic outlook on life, she finds that beauty and confidence can bring their own share of heartache. Romantic drama, starring Bette Davis, Paul Henreid, Claude Rains, Gladys Cooper and Bonita Granville

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: A profile of an actress whose Hollywood career took off with the fledgling film production company Warner Brothers in 1932. The programme includes her TV appearances made over the years, and captures the milestones and highlights of her fame, including her role in What Ever Happened to Baby Jane? in which she co-starred with Joan Crawford as a former child star caring for her disabled sister. Narrated by Sylvia Syms

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Documentary following Baghani, a tigress chosen to breed in the wild. She is airlifted from her home in an Indian park to a new reserve where she encounters Rajore, a male who has also recently been released. The pair are filmed over two years, as they fight leopards for territory and learn to hunt boar, while trying to avoid being killed by poachers

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: At Blackburn Cathedral, Charles Hanson values a rare Eureka clock and Anita Manning is drawn to four oil paintings of the Ribble Valley. Host Paul Martin meets up with Michelin-star chef Nigel Haworth to discover how to make the perfect Lancashire hotpot

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Made in Chelsea's Sam Thompson takes to the Cotswolds B-roads with his best friend, Pete Wicks from The Only Way is Essex. Under the supervision of experts Margie Cooper and Raj Bisram, these reality TV star rivals go head-to-head as they swap on-screen antics for auction-worthy antiques

programme.title: Lucy Worsley Investigates
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley uncovers royal papers and explores how the attempt on George III's life by a mentally ill subject changed psychiatry forever

programme.title: Love Songs at the BBC: Volume 2
programme.desc: A selection of performances of love songs from the BBC's music archives, including the sounds of Nat King Cole, Shania Twain, Billy Joel, Ed Sheeran and many, many more

programme.title: Heartbreakers at the BBC
programme.desc: Classic heart-breaking BBC performances from some of music's biggest stars, including George Michael, Amy Winehouse, Sam Smith, Taylor Swift and - of course - the queen 'Heartbreaker' herself, soul legend Dionne Warwick

programme.title: Love Songs at the BBC: A Valentine's Day Special
programme.desc: A selection of romantic songs for guilty pleasures, for courtship, for declarations of love, for looking someone in the eye and whispering sweet nothings, accompanied by a compilation of some of the greatest love songs from the likes of Celine Dion, Joe Cocker and Jennifer Warnes, Jason and Kylie, 10cc and Lionel Richie, all from the Top of the Pops era

programme.title: Barry White in Concert 1975
programme.desc: A recording of the soul singer's performance with his Love Unlimited Orchestra at the Royal Albert Hall in 1975

programme.title: Celine Dion at the BBC
programme.desc: A collection of archive appearances on the BBC over the years by the Canadian singer, including footage of her representing Switzerland at Eurovision in 1988 with the song Ne partez pas sans moi and performances of Beauty and the Beast and My Heart Will Go On

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.desc: Inspired by Blackbeard's words of wisdom, Stede enlists the Revenge crew to help him intimidate an incoming merchant ship. Izzy confronts Blackbeard about his growing attachment to Stede, while Lucius's flesh wound spirals out of control. Pirate comedy, starring Rhys Darby, Taika Waititi and Con O'Neill

programme.title: The Truth (2019)
programme.desc: A French movie star who has recently published her memoirs is reunited with her daughter, who returns to France from America with her husband and child. The reunion between mother and daughter quickly turns into a bitter confrontation, as truths are told and resentments come to the surface. Drama, starring Catherine Deneuve, Juliette Binoche and Ethan Hawke. In French, English and Mandarin

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores the legacy of Cornwall's tin and copper mining industry, including the story of an endangered species that has taken to living in disused mine shafts. Adam Henson goes in search of a super fertiliser hidden deep under the North York Moors and Tom Heap finds out if mining Cornish lithium could herald a new gold rush

programme.title: Life in a Cottage Garden with Carol Klein
programme.desc: In July and August, the horticulturist deadheads the roses and stakes plants to help keep the garden looking its best during the summer months, and savours the full blooms of geraniums and lilies. She creates colourful borders using cannas, ginger and dahlias, before visiting her local beach, Braunton Burrows, to seek out native sea holly, which she hopes to grow herself

programme.title: Weatherman Walking: The Welsh Coast
programme.desc: Derek Brockway walks from Abersoch to Pwllheli on the Llyn Peninsula, finding some calming beach yoga a good antidote to a testing cliff climb. Derek discovers hoof-prints made in a prehistoric forest millions of years ago, but only recently revealed in shifting sands and stops off at a special retirement village where a little bit of Poland has been recreated in north Wales

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: Armed with a long-standing interest in Zen Buddhism, Monty Don takes his globe-trotting tour to the Orient, where he investigates two very different approaches to gardening in China and Japan. His research leads him first to China's ancient scholars' gardens in Suzhou, and after gaining a new insight into oriental horticulture, he journeys to Kyoto, the Japanese city of gardens

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights from throughout the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Fresh Start
programme.desc: As the chef's experiment draws to a close, he discovers if the families are healthier and happier than they were when they started the challenge 12 weeks ago. To celebrate their achievements, the families come together to take on Tom's final challenge - learning how to cook generous, health-conscious dishes for groups of friends and family

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of recipes to keep children happy, including Paul Hollywood's sausage rolls, James Martin's banana split and Lorraine Pascale's pizza recipe

programme.title: Odette (1950)
programme.desc: The French widow of an English soldier offers her services to British Intelligence, and is sent undercover as a spy in Nazi-occupied France. However, her work alongside the resistance leads to her falling into the clutches of the Gestapo. Fact-based Second World War drama, with Anna Neagle, Trevor Howard, Peter Ustinov and Marius Goring

programme.title: Operation Crossbow (1965)
programme.desc: Three Allied engineers parachute into occupied Holland on a mission to infiltrate and destroy a German missile base. The trio team up with the local resistance, but two of the men are unaware the third is a Nazi agent. Second World War adventure, starring George Peppard, Sophia Loren, Trevor Howard, Tom Courtenay and John Mills

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden aims to bring a slice of Hollywood to Sicily with a banana leaf-patterned boudoir as she takes the reins designing the master bedroom. Alan Carr is concerned her camp theme is on the wrong side of tacky, so she takes him to visit one of Palermo's most prestigious hotels to show how exuberant décor has enticed high-profile guests including famous composer Richard Wagner. To bring her vision to life, Amanda ropes in her DIY-loving father to help build a bespoke four-poster bed. Alan, meanwhile, learns to kick back like the Italians do, with a lesson in the art of doing nothing

programme.title: Italy's Invisible Cities
programme.desc: Using the latest 3D scanning technology, Alexander Armstrong and Dr Michael Scott uncover the hidden history of three Italian cities, beginning with Naples, from its earliest Greek and Roman origins. The pair explore the impact of the volcano of Mount Vesuvius, and how it both nurtured the region and exacted a terrible price on the local population. Alexander and Michael also delve into a labyrinth of underground spaces constructed by ruling Bourbon kings in the 19th century, that helped to sustain the city

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Members of the public bring their antiques and collectibles along to Europe's largest naval aviation museum in Newcastle upon Tyne, where experts Anita Manning and Nick Davies share their knowledge of what everything is worth. Plus, Paul Martin finds our what the people of Tyneside make of Antony Gormley's Angel of the North sculpture

programme.title: Six Nations Highlights
programme.desc: Ugo Monye presents action from the second round of fixtures, featuring Ireland v France at Aviva Stadium, Scotland v Wales at BT Murrayfield and England v Italy at Twickenham. Ireland were looking to end a run of three successive defeats at the hands of the French, while Warren Gatland will have hoped to inspire his side to another win in Scotland, and England will have expected to maintain their unbeaten record against the Azzurri

programme.title: Ski Sunday
programme.desc: Action from the Alpine World Championships in France, featuring the men's and women's downhill event. After the racing, British former slopestyle world champion James Woods goes off grid in the Austrian wilderness as he explores a life on snow away from competition

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: In Scotland and northern England, Alice Roberts investigates an Ice Age camp, a mysterious medieval skeleton and the earliest evidence of salt making in Britain

programme.title: The Warship: Tour of Duty
programme.desc: HMS Queen Elizabeth continues her journey to the South China Sea, but rampant Covid on board means she is not allowed to come ashore for any of the planned port visits. Sailing past Singapore and Hong Kong, the ship has become a floating prison, isolated on the high seas. Her dedicated supply ships do their best to keep the Queen Elizabeth topped up with food, fuel and ammunition. As the QE and her escorting destroyers and frigates enter the contested and potentially dangerous waters of the South China Sea, the Chinese Navy react by probing her with submarines and surface warships. Anti-submarine helicopters launch continually in order to identify, track and see off the subsurface threat

programme.title: Kursk: The Last Mission (2018)
programme.desc: Explosions aboard a Russian submarine cause it to sink during a naval exercise in the Barents Sea, leaving 23 survivors trapped on the ocean floor. For the next seven days, members of a rescue team frantically work to reach the men before their dwindling oxygen supply runs out. Fact-based drama, starring Matthias Schoenaerts, Léa Seydoux and Colin Firth

programme.title: The Man Who Knew Infinity (2015)
programme.desc: The story of the life and academic career of the pioneering Indian mathematician, Srinivasa Ramanujan, and his friendship with his mentor at Trinity College, Cambridge, Professor GH Hardy. Biographical drama, starring Jeremy Irons, Dev Patel and Malcolm Sinclair

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: A list ranking female students causes chaos throughout the school and Samia takes matters into her own hands to find the source, but when she finds out Kelly Jo is keeping things from her they start to fall apart. Danny gets a call from his mum and Preston finds himself seeking emotional support in unexpected places at Kai's party

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Simon Mayo presents the chart show from March 3, 1994, featuring Morrissey, 2 Unlimited, Elvis Costello, Toni Braxton, EYC, Barbara Tucker, Inspiral Carpets and Mariah Carey

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mark Goodier presents the chart show from March 10, 1994, featuring Carter USM, Primal Scream, M People, Janet Jackson, Doop, Marcella Detroit, Bon Jovi and Mariah Carey

programme.title: Sings Bacharach and David!
programme.desc: Archive performances of songs penned by Burt Bacharach and Hal David, featuring artists including Aretha Franklin, Dusty Springfield, the Carpenters, Sandie Shaw and the Stranglers. The programme also features Bacharach himself performing alongside Rufus Wainwright on Later with Jools Holland

programme.title: Kate Bush at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of the singer's performances at the BBC's studios between 1978 and 1994. Bush appeared on a variety of programmes, including Top of the Pops, Wogan, Ask Aspel, Saturday Night at the Mill and the Leo Sayer Show. Featuring the hits Wuthering Heights, Babooshka, Running Up That Hill and Hounds of Love, as well as intriguing and lesser-known material

programme.title: The Kate Bush Story: Running Up That Hill
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the singer-songwriter's career and music from her 1978 debut single Wuthering Heights to her 2011 album 50 Words for Snow with testimony from collaborators, fellow artists inspired by her work and fans. Featuring David Gilmour, the guitarist who discovered Bush, as well as Peter Gabriel, Elton John, Stephen Fry, Outkast's Big Boi and Steve Coogan

programme.title: Kate Bush at the BBC 1979
programme.desc: A Christmas special from 1979 in which the musician performs songs including Gymnopedie No 1, Symphony in Blue, Them Heavy People, Madrigal, December, Wedding List, Egypt, Ran Tan Waltz, Man with the Child in His Eyes and Don't Push Your Foot on the Heartbreak. Peter Gabriel joins Kate for a rendition of Another Day and sings Here Comes the Flood

programme.title: Joni Mitchell: A Woman of Heart and Mind
programme.desc: Documentary profiling the musician famed for her poetry and songs such as Big Yellow Taxi, Both Sides Now and Woodstock. Through a series of interviews and clips of her performing, the singer talks about the emotional extremes of being an artist and how these feelings inspired the music that defined a generation

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Simon Mayo presents the chart show from March 3, 1994, featuring Morrissey, 2 Unlimited, Elvis Costello, Toni Braxton, EYC, Barbara Tucker, Inspiral Carpets and Mariah Carey

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mark Goodier presents the chart show from March 10, 1994, featuring Carter USM, Primal Scream, M People, Janet Jackson, Doop, Marcella Detroit, Bon Jovi and Mariah Carey

programme.title: Sings Bacharach and David!
programme.desc: Archive performances of songs penned by Burt Bacharach and Hal David, featuring artists including Aretha Franklin, Dusty Springfield, the Carpenters, Sandie Shaw and the Stranglers. The programme also features Bacharach himself performing alongside Rufus Wainwright on Later with Jools Holland

programme.title: Arctic with Bruce Parry
programme.desc: The adventurer travels to a remote Russian village deep within a forest that stretches for thousands of miles, where people rely on the food they can gather from their surroundings. He then heads to Norway to spend time with the Sami reindeer herders who use snowmobiles, boats and sometimes helicopters to move their animals. His six-month journey through the Arctic concludes with a visit to a scientific community in the Svalbard archipelago, where he learns about the fragility of the ecosystem - before witnessing the aurora borealis, also known as the northern lights

programme.title: Simon King's Shetland Diaries
programme.desc: Spring brings an influx of wildlife to the islands, where the former Springwatch presenter is living for a year. Exploring the sea, Simon discovers starfish, moon jellyfish and gets close to a seal. He also follows the struggle at a wildlife sanctuary to teach an injured otter cub to use its back legs, and gives his daughter Savannah a lesson in birdwatching

programme.title: North Sea Connection
programme.desc: Swedish narcotics detective Tuva Palsson continues her investigation into the possible drug smuggling and also makes inquiries about Bjorn. Aidan takes delivery of the fish-processing plant equipment and waxes lyrical to Ciara about his plans for the business, only to be interrupted by a call from Shane about Lenny

programme.title: North Sea Connection
programme.desc: When a distraught Hana makes a shocking discovery at Lenny's place, Egan and the Dublin detective sent to investigate conclude it was a tragic accident. Aidan and Ciara are summoned to the unit where Evie gives them orders that further enmeshes them with the cartel, while Tuva startles Bjorn when she reveals she knows all about his past in Sweden

programme.title: Early Doors
programme.desc: Rumours circulate about Ken quitting as landlord, leaving the regulars horrified their beloved boozer will become a 'fun pub'. Joe shares his personal problems with Duffy, Jean continues sleepwalking, and Eddie's well-meaning help threatens to scupper Joan's chances of passing her driving test

programme.title: Early Doors
programme.desc: The regulars celebrate Mel's 21st birthday, with Nicola desperately trying to attract DJ Joe's attention and Phil and Nige contemplating a new business venture. However, Ken remains in a gloomy mood, with Tanya's departure and an unwelcome visitor weighing heavily on his mind

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Richard's business empire begins to crumble, leaving him with little option but to sell Grantleigh Manor. On receiving an inheritance from her late uncle, Audrey is finally able to reclaim the estate - and DeVere. The original final episode of the 1970s sitcom, starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles

programme.title: The Many Faces of
programme.desc: The Liverpool-born actress reminisces about her career, including her successes with director and ex-husband Mike Leigh, with whom she created the monstrous Beverly in 1970s play Abigail's Party. She focuses on her early screen appearances, and reveals what influenced her choice of roles. With clips from Gavin & Stacey, Newshounds, Nuts in May and Frost Weekly

programme.title: Rich Hall's Working for the American Dream
programme.desc: Rich Hall explores the ethos of the American dream, and uncovers how it has been explored and perpetuated by politicians, industrialists, writers and artists

programme.title: Simon King's Shetland Diaries
programme.desc: Spring brings an influx of wildlife to the islands, where the former Springwatch presenter is living for a year. Exploring the sea, Simon discovers starfish, moon jellyfish and gets close to a seal. He also follows the struggle at a wildlife sanctuary to teach an injured otter cub to use its back legs, and gives his daughter Savannah a lesson in birdwatching

programme.title: Come Dancing
programme.desc: Terry Wogan presents the final of the 1979 amateur dance contest, between North West and Midlands and West, at the Guildhall, Southampton. Ray Moore provides the commentary

programme.title: Chamber Music at the BBC
programme.desc: Petroc Trelawny delves into the BBC film archive for footage of one of Britain's best-loved classical stars - charismatic French cellist Paul Tortelier, whose regular TV appearances in the 1960s and 1970s made him a household name. The programme includes extracts from his popular series of televised masterclasses, an early performance of Elgar's Cello Concerto, and some intimate family music-making with his wife and children - including his son Yan Pascal

programme.title: New Generation Artists Presents
programme.desc: Georgia Mann presents an intimate showcase of Radio 3 New Generation Artists performing in the Coal Exchange building in Cardiff Bay. In the second of two programmes, German pianist Elisabeth Brauss plays Chopin's Scherzo No 2 in B flat minor, alongside three keyboard sonatas by Domenico Scarlatti. Scottish guitarist Sean Shibe performs a selection of Scottish lute music and Dowland's Fantasia. British soprano Ruby Hughes, who is joined by Indian-American pianist Kunal Lahiry, sings music by Strauss, Purcell and Britten, and the Aris Quartet perform a selection of Ervin Schulhoff's Five Pieces for String Quartet

programme.title: The Wedding
programme.desc: Monologues from guests at a black Scottish wedding, including the thoughts of the groom's closest friend, a bartender and an outcast uncle. Performed by Brian James Leys, Lola Aluko and Bruce Fummey

programme.title: The Wedding
programme.desc: Monologues from guests at a black Scottish wedding, featuring a cultural conundrum, a tense reunion and a motherly message. Performed by Nandi Hudson, Moyo Akandé and Michelle Chantelle Hopewell

programme.title: Byzantium: A Tale of Three Cities
programme.desc: Historian Simon Sebag Montefiore explores modern Istanbul in search of evidence of the last centuries of Christian Constantinople, which produced a golden artistic renaissance. There's also a look at how, after the epic siege of 1453, the Ottomans seized control of the city, which became their imperial capital

programme.title: Michael Palin's New Europe
programme.desc: The intrepid traveller continues his journey around eastern Europe by visiting the Baltic states of Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania. He tells the story of how three tiny nations escaped the oppression of the Soviet Union and reclaimed a culture that was once thought lost. Michael celebrates the pagan festival of Jaani, embarks on a session of fire-walking, and comes to understand why Lithuania is often referred to as 'A Singing Nation'

programme.title: Opera Italia
programme.desc: Antonio Pappano traces Verdi's role in Italian history and culture, travelling to Le Roncole to learn about the composer's childhood amid political turmoil, and discovering the effect this had on his operas in later life. He examines six of Verdi's most famous works, rehearses La Traviata at London's Royal Opera House, and conducts Va Pensiero from Nabucco at an open-air concert in Naples

programme.title: Princess Margaret: The Rebel Royal
programme.desc: Part two of two. Experts analyse the Princess's marriage to Lord Snowdon at the start of the 1960s. At home with celebrities and artists, they're riding the wave of a cultural and sexual revolution that's transforming Britain. The mystique of monarchy is being increasingly undermined by the emergence of a more open and egalitarian society

programme.title: My Life
programme.desc: Chelcea's biggest passion is for hair! In this documentary, she shows us how she does her hair at home, doing her own hair, her mum's hair, her sister's hair, her friend's hair and even her dad's beard. Shemhas been doing lots of different hairstyles for everyone, inlcuding twists, braids (thick and small), plaits, tops buns, and also leaving it out as an afro, which is really good for the hair and scalp. Chelcea is an expert on the science of hair and how to look after it, and is particularity interested in natural hair remedies. Chelcea's parents encourage their daughter's passion and, through beautiful animation, we learn about her mum's childhood in the Democratic Republic of Congo. By taking us on her own hair journey, Chelcea's determination to inspire others to celebrate their amazing hair shines through!

The ‘What’s in the Box?’ game reveals the question ‘why?’, and when the toddlers and parents open up a bigger box, they discover lots more objects and toys that are inspired by the question. This theme is explored through exploration, play, song and story. Grown-ups are encouraged to take part at home by hiding a safe, toddler-appropriate ‘why?’ question toy or object inside a recycled box for them to reveal and explore with their toddler! Storytime is all about fun and playful discovery, as the Toddler Twins’ friends Dog and Koala pack a suitcase for a holiday. Dog has lots of things to take, but will everything fit inside? Freeda decides to use her pirate monster call, and a real monster appears: the fearsome and superangry Shark… Now, what will the Fox and the Cat do?

programme.title: Dog Loves Books
programme.desc: One of his workers turns out to be a cat who makes fishy dog biscuits. Dog helps the owner by showing him that he can make money by producing both cat snacks and doggy biscuits.

programme.title: Tee and Mo
programme.desc: Mo is running late, but Tee is moving at his own speed.

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: The Colourblocks decorate Purple's garden and learn about patterns. Discover how to make your own patterns with the Colourblocks.

programme.title: Olga Da Polga
programme.desc: Karen brings home some mysterious creatures, but who are they and where did they come from? Olga asks Noel for help to investigate the new arrivals as she wonders whether they can be new friends or if Karen has a new favourite pet? Once she meets them properly, Olga decides they are her new ‘school friends’!

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: Great Gran Gran shows JoJo her St Lucian local newsletter, and JoJo is inspired to make her own community newsletter. They go out and about finding news for it. Cynthia tells them that a mystery guest is turning on the winter market lights, Charlene shares that she has special bunting for sale at the winter market, and Navid tells them about his new food stall. JoJo & Gran Gran get working on making their newsletter. Everyone loves the newsletter, and they are all excited to see the mystery guest turn on the winter market lights.

programme.title: Big Cook Little Cook
programme.desc: Jen has brought in the board game snakes and ladders but has lost the dice. Camar the crocodile comes to visit, Small whizzes off to see how courgettes grow, and the two chefs make courgette crocodile for their snappy guest.

programme.title: Old Jack's Boat: Rockpool Tales
programme.desc: Jack remembers playing a great game of cricket on the beach with Little Ernie, Little Sailor Sue and the tennis ball

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels are digging in the garden when they come across a fossil, so Duggee and Narrator explain all about fossils and prehistoric times. When the Squirrels go outside, it seems like they've gone right back in time

programme.title: Messy Goes to OKIDO
programme.desc: Messy wants to run further, but he keeps getting out of breath. Will he able to take on the Great Okido Challenge and race to the finish line?

programme.title: Bitz & Bob
programme.desc: Bitz, Bob and Purl are on a treasure hunt in Big Hot Sandy Desert, Bob finds a dusty old lamp, and a quick polish reveals it's the home of Bevel Genie and his pets

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Love Monster has to keep Elder Kitten busy while everyone organises a surprise party

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: It's an aerial adventure in Gibraltar as the team follows a group of migrating baby birds. Cartoon following four superheroes as they explore the world

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Glitch causes catastrophe on Whistler Mountain in Canada in a cable car hanging from a wire stretching three kilometres across the valley, higher than the Eiffel Tower

programme.title: Dog Loves Books
programme.desc: Dog wants some high adventure, so he and Pug visit several different stories. Each time they arrive in their new story, they find that they are being chased by various characters. Mrs Honey Bunny comes to their rescue, chasing away all the chasers.

programme.title: Timmy Time
programme.desc: The lamb decides to have a day collecting blue toys, cushions and paint, but finds he needs more than one colour to create a picture

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin and his friends visit a water park, and Mr Tumble dances in the rain.

programme.title: Ranger Hamza's Eco Quest
programme.desc: Ranger Hamza and the Ramblers discover how buzzards play such an important role in the environment. They find out that they help nature stay in balance and that buzzards living in an area can tell us if it is a healthy habitat. On the way, they spot buzzards flying in the sky and learn that their wings stretch to the height of a Rambler!

programme.title: Kiri & Lou
programme.desc: Pania, Kiri and Lou visit the hot springs.

programme.title: Pablo
programme.desc: At the city farm, Pablo tries being a chicken, a pig and a horse

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertato is delighted when Evil Pea comes to his birthday party, but Carrot is suspicious. Soon Evil Pea unleashes the Mini Peas, who try to steal Supertato's birthday present

programme.title: Messy Goes to OKIDO
programme.desc: After a button-pressing 'accident' at the Fab Food Factory, a giant popcorn is on the loose in OKIDO. Will Messy and Zoom be able to stop it before it flattens the city?

programme.title: Grace's Amazing Machines
programme.desc: CBeebies' motorbike rider Grace shows off three amazing emergency machines

programme.title: Andy's Wild Adventures
programme.desc: Andy and Kip see chameleons in Tanzania, Africa, and the presenter tries out a special camouflage costume of his own

programme.title: Roots and Fruits
programme.desc: Live from the Roots and Fruits theatre, it’s the magical Pineapple attempting to perform a very difficult magic trick with the help of Kiwi.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Energetic animation for children aged two to five, following Duggee the dog and his Squirrel Club

programme.title: Magic Hands
programme.desc: Ashley Kendall, Aimee Campbell-Nottage, Donna Mullings and Simon Herdman present a poetry programme using a mix of sign language, the spoken word, music and animation to bring poems to life and capture the imaginations of both deaf and hearing children

programme.title: Treasure Champs
programme.desc: Kari is scared of playing her trumpet in front of the Treasure Champs, but Barry reminds her how he had courage to buy her trumpet in the first place. Barry also shows courage by going into a dark cave where a funny creature lives. Storyteller Ben Langley visits a zoo to tell the story of Daniel and the Lion's den

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and friends get ambushed by the Terriers!

programme.title: Andy's Wild Adventures
programme.desc: Andy takes Kip the cat to Kenya, where they see wild flamingos and observe tiny chicks in their nest

programme.title: Ranger Hamza's Eco Quest
programme.desc: Ranger Hamza and the Ramblers discover how seaweed plays such an important role in the environment. They find out that seaweed can be a shelter for lots of sea creatures, a great place for seabirds to look for food to eat, and that seaweed helps provide some of the oxygen we breathe. On the way, they see what they can spot in a rock pool and have a picnic of some snacks made from seaweed!

programme.title: Katie Morag
programme.desc: Uncle Matthew's hut is blown away in a storm, and both Granma Mainland and Katie come up with plans to to help

programme.title: Nick Cope's Popcast
programme.desc: Nick and Norman are stuck up a tree and Nick discovers the secret of Grandpa's old guitar

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: Sarah is keen to complete her sticker album, so sets off to see if her friends can help with her collection

programme.title: Charlie and Lola
programme.desc: Charlie and Marv have a play-fight, but Lola thinks it is real and means the boys are not best friends anymore

programme.title: Tee and Mo
programme.desc: Mo is trying to do some gardening, but Tee wants to hunt for treasure!

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: A strange robot block lands on the Clangers' planet. It takes soil samples and produces a plan. It soon becomes clear it is looking for a place to build new tower blocks

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: Upsy Daisy and Makka Pakka toss a ball across the garden, but their game becomes dangerous when they go near the Pontipines' house

programme.title: Hushabye Lullabye
programme.desc: It's wash day for Dillie Dally! The Bath-time Ducks enjoy a swim in a bubbly bath and play hide and seek amongst the bubbles. Pop Pop! Pop! Can Dillie Dally find them?

programme.title: CBeebies Bedtime Stories
programme.desc: Joe Wicks tells the tale of a gorilla who really isn't keen on bananas.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye and Rav Wilding round off the working week with a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: Cameras follow daily events at a Co Durham pet hospital, as its specialist vets and staff attend the needs of animals 24 hours each day. A rescue kitten is having trouble walking, so the team investigates why. A French Bulldog is in labour, while a Labrador puppy finds out whether his operation has been a success. Narrated by Kieran Bew

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A woman, injured in an accident, sees her claim go belly-up when she gets on the dance floor. A serving police officer gets involved in a brazen attempt to get a payout for bikes that don't even exist. Plus, a disgruntled employee seems willing to harm herself as part of a bogus claim. Presented by Naga Munchetty

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell heads to Shildon in Co Durham to see a two-bed mid-terrace bought by an enthusiastic first-time developer. Dion Dublin visits a rather unusual lot in Derby that has great potential for transformation. Jacqui Joseph is in Seaford, East Sussex, to see a former care home that is also a great opportunity for a developer with the right skills

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from Newark Showground in Nottinghamshire, where experts Izzie Balmer and Nick Hall are on hand to try to steer the competing teams to a profit at auction. Eric also visits Bestwood Winding Engine House, which used to be one of the busiest collieries in the county

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The visit of Princess Margaret to Kembleford is jeopardised when a school caretaker is found murdered. It falls to Father Brown to resolve matters and save the royal occasion from being cancelled. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: Amy Dowden's Dare to Dance
programme.desc: The dance champion and Strictly star helps people who'd love to dance but have never done so, by teaching a spectacular routine to surprise family and friends. Emily is a rugby player who's got a dream to dance solo in front of the rugby club

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A London couple look to swap the sound of the Bow bells for cow bells as Jules Hudson helps them to spend their £500,000 budget on a house with a music room and a dog-friendly garden in the Derbyshire countryside. While there, Jules works up an appetite as he harvests some delicious mushrooms cultivated in an old converted mill

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Brenton West and leather expert Suzie Fletcher work their collective magic on an antique camera. The item has seized shut and Brenton needs to utilise brute strength and some inventiveness to get it working again, while Suzie works her magic on the tired leather case. A childhood puppet and an unusual timepiece are also restored. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Balaji, Anjali, Bala and Ajit compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Alex Brooker

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Six Nations Sin Bin
programme.desc: Gabby Logan and Gareth Thomas are joined by Death In Paradise star Ralf Little, Question Of Sport captain Sam Quek and former Scotland International Thom Evans to look ahead to the weekend's fixtures. Plus, JJ Chalmers and Aimee Fuller take on ex-Scotland winger Tommy Seymour in this week's Six Nations Showdown

programme.title: Kiri's TV Flashback
programme.desc: Kiri Pritchard-McLean draws on old TV clips to recall some Welsh people thinking outside the box. From olive farmers to coracle fishermen, they were all doing things a bit differently to help triumph the nation of Wales

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Nish is determined to reaffirm his position as head of the Panesar family empire. Lola realises she's spreading herself too thin and decides to spend less time with Emma. Reiss manages to evict Jed from Sonia's home and Linda prepares for her first Valentine's Day without Mick

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden aims to bring a slice of Hollywood to Sicily with a banana leaf-patterned boudoir as she takes the reins designing the master bedroom. Alan Carr is concerned her camp theme is on the wrong side of tacky, so she takes him to visit one of Palermo's most prestigious hotels to show how exuberant décor has enticed high-profile guests including famous composer Richard Wagner. To bring her vision to life, Amanda ropes in her DIY-loving father to help build a bespoke four-poster bed. Alan, meanwhile, learns to kick back like the Italians do, with a lesson in the art of doing nothing

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Neville receives an anonymous letter telling them a murder is about to be committed. Not long after, he and Naomi are called to the harbour when a body is pulled from the ocean. The victim suffered blunt trauma and it is soon suggested that his disgruntled wife may be a person of interest. Marlon returns after taking a short holiday following his disappointing exam results. Sun-kissed detective drama, starring Ralf Little, Don Warrington and Ginny Holder

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Mexican star Salma Hayek Pinault promotes new comedy-drama Magic Mike's Last Dance and Oscar-winner Julianne Moore discusses her part in psychological thriller Sharper. Dancer Johannes Radebe talks about his new touring show, and there are appearances from singer-songwriters Shania Twain and Lizzo. Plus, music by Tom Grennan

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Satirist, presenter and producer Munya Chawawa, comedian Bob Mortimer, Professor Alice Roberts and radio presenter Snoochie Shy join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Sam Smith Live at the Royal Albert Hall
programme.desc: A special show filmed in October 2022 at the iconic London venue, which finds the artist accompanied by a conducted orchestra of 12 strings, a four-piece band, three backing singers and four dancers. Sam performs chart-topping smashes Stay with Me, Dancing with a Stranger and I'm Not the Only One, as well as new material from fourth studio album Gloria. Plus, an appearance by pop diva Kim Petras, Sam's co-singer on the hit single Unholy

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Clive Myrie is guest host with writer and comedian Andy Hamilton and journalist Helen Lewis joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the past week's news in this extended episode of the satirical current affairs quiz. From April 2022

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Alex Jones is joined by Josh Widdicombe and Nish Kumar, and chefs Nathan Outlaw and Ravneet Gill. Helen McGinn chooses the wines and there are archive clips featuring Rick Stein, Marcus Wareing, Nigella Lawson and Keith Floyd

programme.title: Six Nations Sin Bin
programme.desc: Gabby Logan and Gareth Thomas are joined by Death In Paradise star Ralf Little, Question Of Sport captain Sam Quek and former Scotland International Thom Evans to look ahead to the weekend's fixtures. programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott looks ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including Leeds United v Manchester United. Plus, updates from the lunchtime kick-off between West Ham United and Chelsea

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Food Fest Wales
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher reveals the secrets of farmers and food producers as he explore Wales' best food festivals. He starts out with a visit to the Abergavenny Food Festival, where he discovers the secrets of barbecuing success from experts Sam and Shauna. Farmer Meinir Howells gets a workout harvesting cockles with fifth-generation pickers in Carmarthenshire and Onkar Singh Purewal, a father of toddler triplets, is on the hunt for healthy food the whole family will eat

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Charles Hanson and David Harper help two teams search for items at Wetherby Racecourse in West Yorkshire, while Charlie Ross challenges fairgoers to guess his mystery item

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Another three sellers enter the Bidding Room in the hope of persuading the dealers to part with their cash in exchange for their items. They include Kasia, with a wind-up toy monkey who clashes his cymbals together, and Joy, with an antique Kings and Queen playing card game. Also hoping to make some cash is Chris, who discovered an ornate lead cherub while renovating his barn and believes it began life as part of a water feature in a stately home

programme.title: Kiri's TV Flashback
programme.desc: Kiri Pritchard-McLean draws on old TV clips to recall some Welsh people thinking outside the box. From olive farmers to coracle fishermen, they were all doing things a bit differently to help triumph the nation of Wales

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Scotland v Wales (Kick-off 4.45pm). Gabby Logan presents all the action from the match in the second round of fixtures, held at BT Murrayfield. Wales prevailed 20-17 when the sides met at Principality Stadium last year thanks to Dan Biggar's drop goal 11 minutes from time. However, that proved to be their only win of the campaign, and victories over England and Italy ensured Scotland finished one place above them in the table in fourth. With analysis from Martin Johnson, John Barclay and Jonathan Davies, and commentary by Andrew Cotter, Chris Paterson and Sam Warburton

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Big Show
programme.desc: Michael presents another hour of entertainment, featuring music from Olly Murs, singing Dancing on Cars, and Stacey Dooley handing over her mobile in Send to All. There's a rude awakening for Alexander Armstrong when he plays the Midnight Gameshow and a pair of Unexpected Stars of the Show are invited to perform a duet

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Ashok drives the wrong way up a motorway and crashes his vehicle into a young couple. While he fears about his papers, Rash - remorseful for the actions of his father - insists he wants to treat one of the injured passengers, who he thinks may be suffering from spinal shock. Marcus drives a wedge between Stevie and her champion Faith, while Paul accidentally reveals a large cut on his arm to a horrified Robyn and admits he sustained it while on shift for Damien

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jacob encounters a fellow jogger who has been trapped between rocks for three days. Unable to raise an alarm due to the remoteness of the location, he has to contemplate performing an amputation then and there. His heroic act impresses Marcus to the extent that he is prepared to work with Jacob in addressing the problem of a skeleton staff in ED. Marcus warns Dylan to drop the care home patients issue, but his obsession risks him losing his job. Paige accidentally falls asleep in the staff room and it seems clear her work is suffering as a result of helping Rash

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee organises a family camping trip in an attempt to bring the generations together. However, even though he remembers to bring his guitar for campfire sing-songs, he forgets to check the weather. When Lucy finds something in the woods that looks very much like a human bone the unhappy campers cannot wait to leave. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including West Ham United v Chelsea at London Stadium and Arsenal v Brentford at Emirates Stadium. The Hammers were looking to avenge a 2-1 defeat at the hands of Chelsea in September, while the title-chasing Gunners will have hoped to emulate their strong display in a 3-0 win over the Bees at Brentford Community Stadium. Plus, Crystal Palace v Brighton & Hove Albion, Fulham v Nottingham Forest, Leicester City v Tottenham Hotspur, Southampton v Wolverhampton Wanderers and Bournemouth v Newcastle United

programme.title: The Notebook (2004)
programme.desc: An elderly man reads a love story to a woman in a nursing home, from an old notebook full of sentimental scribblings about passionate young couple Allie and Noah, whose fledgling affair in the 1940s is smothered almost before it has begun when Allie's parents do not approve of her partner as he does not fit in with their other wealthy friends. Romantic drama, starring Ryan Gosling, Rachel McAdams, Gena Rowlands and James Garner

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Claire McCollum marks Valentine's Day by discovering the extraordinary 275-year history of love and marriage at Gretna Green, from young lovers eloping in the 18th century through to the 3,000-plus couples who still get married in the tiny border village each year. Claire also meets the parents who made history as the first same-sex couple in Scotland to be approved for adoption

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Belfast man Nathan Campbell wants to start a new life in New Zealand, but his wife and children are not convinced. A trial stay in Auckland sees Nathan, his wife Ashleigh and their two children check out what is on offer

programme.desc: The contestants must work in pairs to dash around the supermarket and cook a feast on a budget of £30. Their dish must be all their own, but they must design a menu in their pairs

programme.title: Young MasterChef
programme.desc: The Young MasterChef final five are back to show judges Poppy and Kerth their sweet side in the form of an ice cream parlour challenge

programme.title: Slammed: The Seventies
programme.desc: After winning a Grand Slam, the star players of Wales are eyeing up the ultimate test - a British and Irish Lions tour against the All Blacks - but what will happen in New Zealand will change the life of the prodigiously talented outside half, Barry John

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: Bakari and the rest of the baboons can see no escape when the lions take over their home - until the pride fall asleep. Baby hippo Mafuta's mother tries to keep the crocodiles from desecrating his dead father's body - but in the ensuing chaos the youngster is swept away down the river. Crocodile Magamba defends her hatchlings and Duma the cheetah struggles to make friends

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Steve Brown head to the North Yorkshire coast and the beautiful village of Staithes to find out how the traditional fishing community is adapting for the future. Where once there was a fishing fleet of 80, now there is just one fishermen left. Joe also goes out to sea to discover how one skipper has swapped nets for wildlife tourism, while Steve takes a look at Staithes' art heritage and tastes some locally-smoked goodies. Adam Henson finds out about the challenges facing a sheep dairy and Charlotte Smith investigates the latest developments behind one of Britain's biggest ecological marine disasters

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The Roadshow travels to Portchester Castle in Hampshire, where treasures include an extraordinary set of RAF medals, awarded for extreme bravery to an airman who served in Dunkirk and the Battle of Britain. The team also admires some rare punk clothing by fashion designer Vivienne Westwood and a roll of ornate Arts and Crafts wallpaper destined for the bonfire. Amin Jaffer appraises two valuable paintings by prominent 20th-century Indian artists, Jamini Roy and KH Ara, and explains how each man expressed ideas of Indian identity and nationhood in their works

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Everyone is looking forward to Trixie and Matthew's wedding and a bonny baby competition brings the community together. It's not all good news, however, as the team learn about a pregnant woman and her family living in a cramped caravan, while a worrying disease outbreak directly impacts the residents of Nonnatus House

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: Crime drama inspired by the true story of the 1983 Brink's-Mat gold robbery, telling the story from the point of view of both the police and the criminals. When £26million worth of gold is stolen from the Brink's-Mat security depot near Heathrow Airport, long-serving DCI Brian Boyce arrives from counter-terrorism and sets up a task force to investigate. Meanwhile, robbery ringleader Micky McAvoy tries to dispose of the bullion. Starring Hugh Bonneville, Dominic Cooper and Charlotte Spencer

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Leeds United v Manchester United at Elland Road and Manchester City v Aston Villa at the Etihad Stadium. City were looking to maintain the pressure on Arsenal at the top of the table, while the two Uniteds met for the second time in five days. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.desc: Highlights of the weekend's games in the Super League, including Manchester City v Arsenal and Tottenham Hotspur v Manchester United

programme.desc: A woman who cannot retain her memories following a traumatic accident is contacted by a mysterious neuropsychologist, who offers to help her recover the truth about her condition. As she tries to piece together the events of her past, she begins to fear neither her husband nor the doctor are who they seem to be. Thriller, starring Nicole Kidman, Colin Firth and Mark Strong
