programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A London couple look to swap the sound of the Bow bells for cow bells as Jules Hudson helps them to spend their £500,000 budget on a house with a music room and a dog-friendly garden in the Derbyshire countryside. While there, Jules works up an appetite as he harvests some delicious mushrooms cultivated in an old converted mill

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Brenton West and leather expert Suzie Fletcher work their collective magic on an antique camera. The item has seized shut and Brenton needs to utilise brute strength and some inventiveness to get it working again, while Suzie works her magic on the tired leather case. A childhood puppet and an unusual timepiece are also restored. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Balaji, Anjali, Bala and Ajit compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Alex Brooker

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Ronan Keating round off the working week with the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Nish is determined to reaffirm his position as head of the Panesar family empire. Lola realises she's spreading herself too thin and decides to spend less time with Emma. Reiss manages to evict Jed from Sonia's home and Linda prepares for her first Valentine's Day without Mick

programme.title: Life on the Bay
programme.desc: Food and Beverage Manager Janet is offered a new role at the park. At the hotel, it's wedding season and the small but dedicated team needs to pull out all the stops to make sure Jacqueline and Claire's big day runs smoothly. An impromptu visit to the site leads to a new holiday home for Georgia

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden aims to bring a slice of Hollywood to Sicily with a banana leaf-patterned boudoir as she takes the reins designing the master bedroom. Alan Carr is concerned her camp theme is on the wrong side of tacky, so she takes him to visit one of Palermo's most prestigious hotels to show how exuberant décor has enticed high-profile guests including famous composer Richard Wagner. To bring her vision to life, Amanda ropes in her DIY-loving father to help build a bespoke four-poster bed. Alan, meanwhile, learns to kick back like the Italians do, with a lesson in the art of doing nothing

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Neville receives an anonymous letter telling them a murder is about to be committed. Not long after, he and Naomi are called to the harbour when a body is pulled from the ocean. The victim suffered blunt trauma and it is soon suggested that his disgruntled wife may be a person of interest. Marlon returns after taking a short holiday following his disappointing exam results. Sun-kissed detective drama, starring Ralf Little, Don Warrington and Ginny Holder

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Mexican star Salma Hayek Pinault promotes new comedy-drama Magic Mike's Last Dance and Oscar-winner Julianne Moore discusses her part in psychological thriller Sharper. Dancer Johannes Radebe talks about his new touring show, and there are appearances from singer-songwriters Shania Twain and Lizzo. Plus, music by Tom Grennan

programme.title: A View from the Terrace
programme.desc: Craig G Telfer, Craig Fowler, Shaughan McGuigan, Robert Borthwick and Joel Sked present a sideways look at Scottish football, dissecting of ins and outs of the week's action, with a variety of features covering the full spectrum from the giants to the minnows

programme.title: Sam Smith Live at the Royal Albert Hall
programme.desc: A special show filmed in October 2022 at the iconic London venue, which finds the artist accompanied by a conducted orchestra of 12 strings, a four-piece band, three backing singers and four dancers. Sam performs chart-topping smashes Stay with Me, Dancing with a Stranger and I'm Not the Only One, as well as new material from fourth studio album Gloria. Plus, an appearance by pop diva Kim Petras, Sam's co-singer on the hit single Unholy

programme.title: That's My Jam
programme.desc: Mo Gilligan hosts the music game show. Courtney Act and The Vivienne take on Ricki Lake and Reggie Watts as they face some super-sized musical challenges, pushing their singing abilities, performance skills and musical knowledge to the limit as they compete to be declared this week's That's My Jam champions

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Alex Jones is joined by Josh Widdicombe and Nish Kumar, and chefs Nathan Outlaw and Ravneet Gill. Helen McGinn chooses the wines and there are archive clips featuring Rick Stein, Marcus Wareing, Nigella Lawson and Keith Floyd

programme.title: The Great Food Guys
programme.desc: Nick Nairn and Dougie Vipond are joined by sports presenter Eilidh Barbour as they focus on seafood, cooking grilled Scottish lobster with chilli and garlic

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott looks ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including Leeds United v Manchester United. Plus, updates from the lunchtime kick-off between West Ham United and Chelsea

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Six Nations Sin Bin
programme.desc: Gabby Logan and Gareth Thomas are joined by Death In Paradise star Ralf Little, Question Of Sport captain Sam Quek and former Scotland International Thom Evans to look ahead to the weekend's fixtures. Plus, JJ Chalmers and Aimee Fuller take on ex-Scotland winger Tommy Seymour in this week's Six Nations Showdown

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Charles Hanson and David Harper help two teams search for items at Wetherby Racecourse in West Yorkshire, while Charlie Ross challenges fairgoers to guess his mystery item

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson unearths a handful of innovative property choices in the landscape of Perth and Kinross on a budget of £210,000. He also learns about efforts being made to conserve the salmon population of the River Tay

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Scotland v Wales (Kick-off 4.45pm). Gabby Logan presents all the action from the match in the second round of fixtures, held at BT Murrayfield. Wales prevailed 20-17 when the sides met at Principality Stadium last year thanks to Dan Biggar's drop goal 11 minutes from time. However, that proved to be their only win of the campaign, and victories over England and Italy ensured Scotland finished one place above them in the table in fourth. With analysis from Martin Johnson, John Barclay and Jonathan Davies, and commentary by Andrew Cotter, Chris Paterson and Sam Warburton

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Big Show
programme.desc: Michael presents another hour of entertainment, featuring music from Olly Murs, singing Dancing on Cars, and Stacey Dooley handing over her mobile in Send to All. There's a rude awakening for Alexander Armstrong when he plays the Midnight Gameshow and a pair of Unexpected Stars of the Show are invited to perform a duet

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Ashok drives the wrong way up a motorway and crashes his vehicle into a young couple. While he fears about his papers, Rash - remorseful for the actions of his father - insists he wants to treat one of the injured passengers, who he thinks may be suffering from spinal shock. Marcus drives a wedge between Stevie and her champion Faith, while Paul accidentally reveals a large cut on his arm to a horrified Robyn and admits he sustained it while on shift for Damien

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jacob encounters a fellow jogger who has been trapped between rocks for three days. Unable to raise an alarm due to the remoteness of the location, he has to contemplate performing an amputation then and there. His heroic act impresses Marcus to the extent that he is prepared to work with Jacob in addressing the problem of a skeleton staff in ED. Marcus warns Dylan to drop the care home patients issue, but his obsession risks him losing his job. Paige accidentally falls asleep in the staff room and it seems clear her work is suffering as a result of helping Rash

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee organises a family camping trip in an attempt to bring the generations together. However, even though he remembers to bring his guitar for campfire sing-songs, he forgets to check the weather. When Lucy finds something in the woods that looks very much like a human bone the unhappy campers cannot wait to leave. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Amy Irons presents action from the fifth-round ties, including Raith Rovers v Motherwell, Dundee United v Kilmarnock and Celtic v St Mirren

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including West Ham United v Chelsea at London Stadium and Arsenal v Brentford at Emirates Stadium. The Hammers were looking to avenge a 2-1 defeat at the hands of Chelsea in September, while the title-chasing Gunners will have hoped to emulate their strong display in a 3-0 win over the Bees at Brentford Community Stadium. Plus, Crystal Palace v Brighton & Hove Albion, Fulham v Nottingham Forest, Leicester City v Tottenham Hotspur, Southampton v Wolverhampton Wanderers and Bournemouth v Newcastle United

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including West Ham United v Chelsea at London Stadium and Arsenal v Brentford at Emirates Stadium. The Hammers were looking to avenge a 2-1 defeat at the hands of Chelsea in September, while the title-chasing Gunners will have hoped to emulate their strong display in a 3-0 win over the Bees at Brentford Community Stadium. programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: The Sunday Show
programme.desc: Martin Geissler presents the main issues from the world of politics and beyond, featuring interviews, discussion and analysis on the stories that matter to Scotland

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Holly Hamilton present topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The team reports on three sets of developers taking on three very different auction properties in London and Wolverhampton, with hammer prices ranging from just over £100,000 to nearly half a million. Time will tell whether all three investors will deliver stunning renovations

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp hosts from Southwell Racecourse in Nottinghamshire, where experts Thomas Forrester and Tim Weeks help competing teams bag the best buys to make a profit at auction. Natasha also investigates a mystery item that dates back to the mid-19th century

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Claire McCollum marks Valentine's Day by discovering the extraordinary 275-year history of love and marriage at Gretna Green, from young lovers eloping in the 18th century through to the 3,000-plus couples who still get married in the tiny border village each year. Claire also meets the parents who made history as the first same-sex couple in Scotland to be approved for adoption

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah showcases a selection of Cotswolds properties to a couple from Essex who are hoping their budget of £550,000 will buy them a new home with three bedrooms, one of which could be used for a home office

programme.title: Chicken Run (2000)
programme.desc: A headstrong chicken and her fellow fowls ponder how to escape from a grim Yorkshire farm before the evil farmer's wife can turn them into pies. Luckily, help arrives in the form of a heroic American rooster who promises to show them how to fly. Nick Park's animated comedy, with the voices of Mel Gibson, Julia Sawalha, Miranda Richardson and Jane Horrocks

programme.title: Young MasterChef
programme.desc: The contestants must work in pairs to dash around the supermarket and cook a feast on a budget of £30. Their dish must be all their own, but they must design a menu in their pairs

programme.title: Young MasterChef
programme.desc: The Young MasterChef final five are back to show judges Poppy and Kerth their sweet side in the form of an ice cream parlour challenge

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: Bakari and the rest of the baboons can see no escape when the lions take over their home - until the pride fall asleep. Baby hippo Mafuta's mother tries to keep the crocodiles from desecrating his dead father's body - but in the ensuing chaos the youngster is swept away down the river. Crocodile Magamba defends her hatchlings and Duma the cheetah struggles to make friends

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Steve Brown head to the North Yorkshire coast and the beautiful village of Staithes to find out how the traditional fishing community is adapting for the future. Where once there was a fishing fleet of 80, now there is just one fishermen left. Joe also goes out to sea to discover how one skipper has swapped nets for wildlife tourism, while Steve takes a look at Staithes' art heritage and tastes some locally-smoked goodies. Adam Henson finds out about the challenges facing a sheep dairy and Charlotte Smith investigates the latest developments behind one of Britain's biggest ecological marine disasters

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The Roadshow travels to Portchester Castle in Hampshire, where treasures include an extraordinary set of RAF medals, awarded for extreme bravery to an airman who served in Dunkirk and the Battle of Britain. The team also admires some rare punk clothing by fashion designer Vivienne Westwood and a roll of ornate Arts and Crafts wallpaper destined for the bonfire. Amin Jaffer appraises two valuable paintings by prominent 20th-century Indian artists, Jamini Roy and KH Ara, and explains how each man expressed ideas of Indian identity and nationhood in their works

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Everyone is looking forward to Trixie and Matthew's wedding and a bonny baby competition brings the community together. It's not all good news, however, as the team learn about a pregnant woman and her family living in a cramped caravan, while a worrying disease outbreak directly impacts the residents of Nonnatus House

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: Crime drama inspired by the true story of the 1983 Brink's-Mat gold robbery, telling the story from the point of view of both the police and the criminals. When £26million worth of gold is stolen from the Brink's-Mat security depot near Heathrow Airport, long-serving DCI Brian Boyce arrives from counter-terrorism and sets up a task force to investigate. Meanwhile, robbery ringleader Micky McAvoy tries to dispose of the bullion. Starring Hugh Bonneville, Dominic Cooper and Charlotte Spencer

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Leeds United v Manchester United at Elland Road and Manchester City v Aston Villa at the Etihad Stadium. City were looking to maintain the pressure on Arsenal at the top of the table, while the two Uniteds met for the second time in five days. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Rangers v Partick Thistle. Amy Irons presents action from the fifth-round tie at Ibrox. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the weekend's games in the Super League, including Manchester City v Arsenal and Tottenham Hotspur v Manchester United

programme.title: Before I Go to Sleep (2014)
programme.desc: A woman who cannot retain her memories following a traumatic accident is contacted by a mysterious neuropsychologist, who offers to help her recover the truth about her condition. As she tries to piece together the events of her past, she begins to fear neither her husband nor the doctor are who they seem to be. Thriller, starring Nicole Kidman, Colin Firth and Mark Strong

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye and Rav Wilding round off the working week with a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: Cameras follow events at a Co Durham pet hospital. Bilko the Labrador is rushed in with an extreme allergic reaction. Hope, a Belgian Malinois, has a mystery lump in her throat, while Roxy the Dachshund has a serious case of tremors. Narrated by Kieran Bew

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A woman, injured in an accident, sees her claim go belly-up when she gets on the dance floor. A serving police officer gets involved in a brazen attempt to get a payout for bikes that don't even exist. Plus, a disgruntled employee seems willing to harm herself as part of a bogus claim. Presented by Naga Munchetty

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell heads to Shildon in Co Durham to see a two-bed mid-terrace bought by an enthusiastic first-time developer. Dion Dublin visits a rather unusual lot in Derby that has great potential for transformation. Jacqui Joseph is in Seaford, East Sussex, to see a former care home that is also a great opportunity for a developer with the right skills

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from Newark Showground in Nottinghamshire, where experts Izzie Balmer and Nick Hall are on hand to try to steer the competing teams to a profit at auction. Eric also visits Bestwood Winding Engine House, which used to be one of the busiest collieries in the county

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The visit of Princess Margaret to Kembleford is jeopardised when a school caretaker is found murdered. It falls to Father Brown to resolve matters and save the royal occasion from being cancelled. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Sheep farmers Tim and Tanya have a shot at selling their vodka at Blenheim Palace Food Festival, while Wye Valley brothers Matt and Kit also create a buzz with their mead

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Si King checks in to the B&B by the sea. Si is well known for his part in TV cooking duo The Hairy Bikers, but this time he's riding solo. programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Holly Hamilton present topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The team reports on three sets of developers taking on three very different auction properties in London and Wolverhampton, with hammer prices ranging from just over £100,000 to nearly half a million. Time will tell whether all three investors will deliver stunning renovations

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp hosts from Southwell Racecourse in Nottinghamshire, where experts Thomas Forrester and Tim Weeks help competing teams bag the best buys to make a profit at auction. Natasha also investigates a mystery item that dates back to the mid-19th century

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Claire McCollum marks Valentine's Day by discovering the extraordinary 275-year history of love and marriage at Gretna Green, from young lovers eloping in the 18th century through to the 3,000-plus couples who still get married in the tiny border village each year. Claire also meets the parents who made history as the first same-sex couple in Scotland to be approved for adoption

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah showcases a selection of Cotswolds properties to a couple from Essex who are hoping their budget of £550,000 will buy them a new home with three bedrooms, one of which could be used for a home office

programme.title: Chicken Run (2000)
programme.desc: A headstrong chicken and her fellow fowls ponder how to escape from a grim Yorkshire farm before the evil farmer's wife can turn them into pies. Luckily, help arrives in the form of a heroic American rooster who promises to show them how to fly. Nick Park's animated comedy, with the voices of Mel Gibson, Julia Sawalha, Miranda Richardson and Jane Horrocks

programme.title: Young MasterChef
programme.desc: The contestants must work in pairs to dash around the supermarket and cook a feast on a budget of £30. Their dish must be all their own, but they must design a menu in their pairs

programme.title: Young MasterChef
programme.desc: The Young MasterChef final five are back to show judges Poppy and Kerth their sweet side in the form of an ice cream parlour challenge

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: Bakari and the rest of the baboons can see no escape when the lions take over their home - until the pride fall asleep. Baby hippo Mafuta's mother tries to keep the crocodiles from desecrating his dead father's body - but in the ensuing chaos the youngster is swept away down the river. Crocodile Magamba defends her hatchlings and Duma the cheetah struggles to make friends

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Steve Brown head to the North Yorkshire coast and the beautiful village of Staithes to find out how the traditional fishing community is adapting for the future. Where once there was a fishing fleet of 80, now there is just one fishermen left. Joe also goes out to sea to discover how one skipper has swapped nets for wildlife tourism, while Steve takes a look at Staithes' art heritage and tastes some locally-smoked goodies. Adam Henson finds out about the challenges facing a sheep dairy and Charlotte Smith investigates the latest developments behind one of Britain's biggest ecological marine disasters

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The Roadshow travels to Portchester Castle in Hampshire, where treasures include an extraordinary set of RAF medals, awarded for extreme bravery to an airman who served in Dunkirk and the Battle of Britain. The team also admires some rare punk clothing by fashion designer Vivienne Westwood and a roll of ornate Arts and Crafts wallpaper destined for the bonfire. Amin Jaffer appraises two valuable paintings by prominent 20th-century Indian artists, Jamini Roy and KH Ara, and explains how each man expressed ideas of Indian identity and nationhood in their works

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Everyone is looking forward to Trixie and Matthew's wedding and a bonny baby competition brings the community together. It's not all good news, however, as the team learn about a pregnant woman and her family living in a cramped caravan, while a worrying disease outbreak directly impacts the residents of Nonnatus House

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: Crime drama inspired by the true story of the 1983 Brink's-Mat gold robbery, telling the story from the point of view of both the police and the criminals. When £26million worth of gold is stolen from the Brink's-Mat security depot near Heathrow Airport, long-serving DCI Brian Boyce arrives from counter-terrorism and sets up a task force to investigate. Meanwhile, robbery ringleader Micky McAvoy tries to dispose of the bullion. Starring Hugh Bonneville, Dominic Cooper and Charlotte Spencer

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Leeds United v Manchester United at Elland Road and Manchester City v Aston Villa at the Etihad Stadium. City were looking to maintain the pressure on Arsenal at the top of the table, while the two Uniteds met for the second time in five days. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the weekend's games in the Super League, including Manchester City v Arsenal and Tottenham Hotspur v Manchester United

programme.title: Before I Go to Sleep (2014)
programme.desc: A woman who cannot retain her memories following a traumatic accident is contacted by a mysterious neuropsychologist, who offers to help her recover the truth about her condition. As she tries to piece together the events of her past, she begins to fear neither her husband nor the doctor are who they seem to be. Thriller, starring Nicole Kidman, Colin Firth and Mark Strong

programme.title: BBC 100 Women In Conversation
programme.desc: Priyanka Chopra Jonas never dreamt of becoming famous, but then she won the 2000 Miss World pageant, which provided a 'small-town girl' with a springboard for an international career. But she says she was getting paid 10% of her male co-actor's salary while starring in Bollywood movies, and it's been only during her most recent acting engagement in Hollywood that she has seen the gender pay gap closing for her. In an interview with BBC 100 Women's Yogita Limaye, the Indian actress and producer speaks about her experience with pay parity, body shaming and the pressure social media can bring.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. When Lloyd finds a discarded leg behind the washing machine, he is mistakenly declared a hero for defeating a bloodthirsty spider. Unable to resist the praise and free comics, Lloyd goes along with it... but he's then confronted by an actual spider.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd finds an entire sweetie, but when he is unable to move it on his own, he reluctantly leaves it in the care of a passing wasp while he gets Abacus and PB. When the wasp steals the sweetie and takes it to their nest, Lloyd then gathers a team to stage a sweet-retrieving heist!

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: When Alan is on space junk duty, one of the pieces of debris turns out to be a heat-seeking SAT-MINE that activates and locks onto TB3's heat signature. Back on Earth, Lady Penelope and Parker sneak into a top-secret storage facility to find the mine's deactivation code

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Red Son takes over the Weather Station, a prestigious club that allows its members to control the weather in different parts of the city, in order to restore his father the Demon Bull King back to power - Monkie Kid attempts to defeat Red Son but has a hard time controlling his power, so the Monkey King limits MK's powers so that he can use them effectively until he has time to train and learn to fully control them.

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. After Tang mentions the famed power of the Monkey King to duplicate himself, Monkie Kid decides to create clones so he can stay home and play video games after he has to do a lot of work for his friends - however, he doesn't know how to use his powers, and so the clones wreak havoc...

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: CGI-animated update of the classic children's cartoon from the 1980s. Inspector Gadget has finally defeated the cruel Dr Claw and frozen him in an iceberg in the Arctic north - however, his evil nephew Talon thaws him out and infiltrates HQ posing as an agent in training. Meanwhile, Penny has also become an agent in training and now has Brain as her assistant - the Chief then calls Penny to meet Talon, who is the agency's new recruit, and she instantly falls in love with him.

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: CGI-animated update of the classic children's cartoon from the 1980s. When Penny finds out that Dr Claw is back, she decides to put her Uncle Gadget back on the beat to find Claw's claw when it becomes clear that he's going to use it to destroy HQ. When Talon reveals his true intentions after finding out where Dr Claw's claw is, it's now up to Penny to stop MAD... with help from the amazing Inspector Gadget, of course!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mo thinks that he's going to become a star when Mr Brick chooses him to represent the school in his new advertising campaign, but Mo instead finds his face on a huge billboard with a line telling everybody that he is a very poor student. Angry, Mo wants to get rid of such publicity right now, so he summons the power to control advertising, but he realises that he is forced to advertise everything that he touches at half-power and ends up managing to close the school.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes

Lenny feels sorry for his buddy, but when he tries to console him, he makes things worse without meaning to. Mo is eaten up with paranoia as he's convinced that Sam has always been their mother's favourite - to make sure that he's the one that Selina takes, Mo invokes the power to be the favourite of whoever he wants...

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v Italy (Kick-off 3.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the final match in the second round of fixtures, held at Twickenham. England have won all 29 of the previous meetings between the sides, but the Italians did give them a scare here two years ago when they took an early lead thanks to a Monty Ioane try, before the hosts turned things around, scoring six tries in a 41-18 win. However, Italy are seemingly on an upward curve and will be buoyed by a memorable 22-21 win in Cardiff last March and by an impressive 28-27 victory over Australia in November. With analysis from Clive Woodward, Jonny Wilkinson and Lawrence Dallaglio, pitchside reports by Martin Bayfield and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary from Nick Mullins, Ben Kay and David Flatman

programme.desc: The duo continue to explore Costa Rica. Inspired by childhood memories, the pair head to the country's cloud forest, where they attempt tree climbing. They also visit a local sanctuary that is home to 2000 free roaming dogs, before heading into the countryside to meet a former Olympian in Kayak Slalom, where the father and son go head-to-head in a time trial

programme.title: Super Bowl
programme.desc: Philadelphia Eagles v Kansas City Chiefs (Kick-off 11.30pm). Live coverage of this year's showpiece event, which takes place at State Farm Stadium in Glendale, Arizona. The Chiefs are appearing in this contest for the third time in four years, and will hope to emulate their performance from 2019 when they claimed a 31-20 victory over the San Francisco 49ers to lift the Vince Lombardi Trophy. The Eagles claimed their sole Super Bowl victory one year prior to that with a 41-33 win over the New England Patriots, when back-up quarterback Nick Foles famously caught a one-yard touchdown pass on a trick play that later became known as the Philly Special, and entered NFL folklore. Laura Woods presents, with analysis from Osi Umenyiora and Jason Bell

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. After Tang mentions the famed power of the Monkey King to duplicate himself, Monkie Kid decides to create clones so he can stay home and play video games after he has to do a lot of work for his friends - however, he doesn't know how to use his powers, and so the clones wreak havoc...

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: CGI-animated update of the classic children's cartoon from the 1980s. Inspector Gadget has finally defeated the cruel Dr Claw and frozen him in an iceberg in the Arctic north - however, his evil nephew Talon thaws him out and infiltrates HQ posing as an agent in training. Meanwhile, Penny has also become an agent in training and now has Brain as her assistant - the Chief then calls Penny to meet Talon, who is the agency's new recruit, and she instantly falls in love with him.

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: CGI-animated update of the classic children's cartoon from the 1980s. When Penny finds out that Dr Claw is back, she decides to put her Uncle Gadget back on the beat to find Claw's claw when it becomes clear that he's going to use it to destroy HQ. When Talon reveals his true intentions after finding out where Dr Claw's claw is, it's now up to Penny to stop MAD... with help from the amazing Inspector Gadget, of course!

programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Angry, Mo wants to get rid of such publicity right now, so he summons the power to control advertising, but he realises that he is forced to advertise everything that he touches at half-power and ends up managing to close the school.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. While searching for a game console that Selina has confiscated, Mo finds two tickets for the 'Isaac the Psychic' show, but only one child's ticket! Lenny feels sorry for his buddy, but when he tries to console him, he makes things worse without meaning to. Mo is eaten up with paranoia as he's convinced that Sam has always been their mother's favourite - to make sure that he's the one that Selina takes, Mo invokes the power to be the favourite of whoever he wants...

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v Italy (Kick-off 3.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the final match in the second round of fixtures, held at Twickenham. England have won all 29 of the previous meetings between the sides, but the Italians did give them a scare here two years ago when they took an early lead thanks to a Monty Ioane try, before the hosts turned things around, scoring six tries in a 41-18 win. However, Italy are seemingly on an upward curve and will be buoyed by a memorable 22-21 win in Cardiff last March and by an impressive 28-27 victory over Australia in November. With analysis from Clive Woodward, Jonny Wilkinson and Lawrence Dallaglio, pitchside reports by Martin Bayfield and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary from Nick Mullins, Ben Kay and David Flatman

programme.title: Back to the Future Part II (1989)
programme.desc: Time-travelling teenager Marty McFly travels to the 21st century, where he has to save his children from a terrible fate. However, this proves to have unforeseen consequences when the future version of arch enemy Biff sees a chance to rewrite history for his own benefit, leaving Marty stuck in a twisted parallel universe. Sci-fi comedy sequel, starring Michael J Fox and Christopher Lloyd

programme.title: Love Island
programme.desc: The fifth week begins with the single people living like celebrities in the villa, all under the watchful gaze of viewers. Maya Jama presents

programme.title: Love Island: Aftersun
programme.desc: Maya Jama is joined by celebrity Love Island superfans Mae Muller, Sam Thompson and Indiyah Polack, to dissect all the latest Love Island news and gossip

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg takes up drinking, which both concerns and delights Peter. Meanwhile, Brian begins spying on his neighbours and suspects Principal Shepherd of a crime

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter's new friendship with a paramedic boosts his self-esteem, prompting him to dump his old pals, but he soon realises he cannot keep up with the man's active lifestyle

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan seeks revenge for an embarrassing incident at a high-school prom, in which he was humiliated on the dancefloor. His chance arrives when he attends a reunion with former homecoming queen Francine, but is devastated to discover two missing ballot papers mean that his wife never officially secured the crown

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Francine fakes an affair to impress the glamorous Ladybugs, but finds they are not the kind of people she wants to be associated with. Stan, however, is happier with his new companion. American animated comedy, with the voices of Wendy Schaal and Seth MacFarlane

programme.title: The Sex Lives of College Girls
programme.desc: Kimberly faces possible expulsion after her honour code violation, Bela takes a stand against the Catullan's culture, and Whitney levels with her mother

programme.title: All American
programme.desc: US sports drama series inspired by the true-life story of NFL Super Bowl champion Spencer Paysinger. Spencer tries not to repeat his past mistakes, Olivia struggles with her sobriety, and Coop has conflicted emotions about reuniting with her father.

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: The peace of an Oxfordshire village is shattered by the apparently motiveless shooting of a woman through her kitchen window. Twenty-four hours later, her next-door neighbour suffers a similar fate. As Morse searches for a link between the victims, he becomes embroiled in an increasingly bitter election contest at an Oxford college. Starring John Thaw, Kevin Whately, Richard Briers, Maggie Steed and John Shrapnel

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The town of Aidensfield falls victim to a spate of burglaries - which all seem to be aimed at Maggie

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick has to go undercover following the unlikely event of a gangster setting up shop in rural Aidensfield - and luckily his former girlfriend Jill is able to help out

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Pauline is all set to achieve her ambition when she is given the chance to join the Portwenn lifeboat crew. However, her joy is short-lived when she discovers the chauvinistic tendencies of her shipmates. Martin is accused of murder by the husband of a woman who died in his care. The irate man resorts to sabotaging Aunt Joan's crops in retaliation but an unexpected twist reveals the true motivation for his ire

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The doctor is surprised when his parents visit out of the blue, but they bring unwelcome tidings for all, especially Aunt Joan, who may be driven from her home. School secretary Maureen receives better news when what she thought was her thyroid problem turns out to be a pregnancy. Louisa calls Martin after Danny collapses - but the ambulance is delayed and emergency surgery must be performed to save his life

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: The duo continue to investigate one of the biggest and darkest cases they have ever faced. In the second edition, Rachel's safety is thrown into question when the killers change the rules of their sick game. Meanwhile, as a police officer, Janet is rendered powerless to protect her daughter, but she knows she must try to find a way to stop the madness. The crime drama returns for a fifth series, this time featuring a single crime throughout three parts. Starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel is criticised for a lack of progress with the investigation and she knows she must find both a murder weapon and the encryption code used to access the website. However, as the team makes a significant breakthrough in the case, DSI Julie Dodson makes a discovery which jeopardises Rachel's position as acting DI. Meanwhile, when Janet's attempt to help Taisie results in a complaint, her faith in justice is tested, and both Scott and Bailey have life-changing decisions to make about their futures. Crime drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Ruth suffers the devastation of losing her baby as her pregnancy comes to an abrupt end, prompting husband Simon to turn to Peggy for support. Passionate feelings emerge between Alison and Stephen, and a medical crisis forces two elderly brothers to reach the conclusion that life's too short to be perpetually at each other's throats. Rural drama, starring Pam Ferris and Sarah Lancashire

programme.desc: Your daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Rosemary's old school friend Dorothy invites the duo to restore the gardens of her beautiful villa on the French Riviera so the property can be opened to the public. The plan arouses bitter hostility among the neighbours and long-held family secrets start to surface, leading to murder. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are hired to investigate why newly planted roses at an upmarket preparatory school keep dying. After witnessing the arcane ritual of the Night of the Stag, they detect tensions between modernising headmaster Quentin Marshall and established members of his staff who are harbouring secrets someone is prepared to kill for. Drama, guest starring Anthony Andrews (Brideshead Revisited), with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: A former bookie falls under suspicion for the murder of a hospital benefactor, who is found dead in his car. As the detectives investigate the case, it becomes clear their prime suspect had a strong motive, believing the victim was responsible for putting his daughter into a coma. Brian Cox guest stars, with John Thaw and Kevin Whately

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: An opera singer is shot by a sniper at an Oxford University ceremony just as she is about to receive an honorary degree. Morse is a big fan of her work and thinks she could not possibly be involved in anything untoward, but his investigations turn up more than a few sordid secrets. Detective drama, starring John Thaw, Kevin Whately, Robert Hardy, Sheila Gish, John Gielgud and Rachel Weisz

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: A man accused of murdering five people is killed in prison shortly before going to trial, wrapping up a lot of loose ends and saving the state the expense of keeping him behind bars indefinitely. Alas, Morse cannot help wondering why the body of one of his victims was never found - and the chance discovery of a corpse gives him the perfect opportunity to investigate further. John Thaw and Kevin Whately star

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway and Lewis investigate a murder committed on the first night of a quiz weekend held at Chaucer College. Sealing the college grounds to interrogate the remaining 11 contestants, the pair discover the victim had a track record for sexual harassment involving fellow competitors, as well as past dealings with a shady engineering business funded by Russian gangsters and masterminded by Oxford professor Charles Milner - another quiz fan. With guest stars Alan Davies (QI), Timothy West (Bleak House) and Nicholas Farrell (The Iron Lady)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Travellers descend on the sleepy village of Martyr Warren, antagonising local magistrate Hector Bridges, whose subsequent death by shooting brings matters to a head in dramatic fashion. Barnaby and Troy's investigation uncovers the victim has a history with one of the travellers - but revelations that he terrorised his family suggest that the killer may be closer to home

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A village of Apern Tallow is rocked by a series of ghostly occurrences that begins with the inexplicable slashing of a painting in the local museum. Barnaby investigates, shadowed by Cully's actor boyfriend, who is preparing for a role as a police officer - but the mysterious events take a far darker turn when a man is found dead on the grave of his ancestor. Prunella Scales guest stars

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Troy is playing in an annual cricket match between Midsomer Worthy and Fletchers Cross when tragedy strikes. The wife of one of the team captains, a wealthy local landowner, is found battered to death with a cricket bat in a quarry. As Barnaby and Troy investigate, they discover no end of people with a grudge against the victim's husband - who may have been complicit in some other suspicious deaths. Guest starring Imelda Staunton and Robert Hardy

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A body is found buried on the Northumberland moors which could be a missing teenager from the nearby rural community of Brindale. The girl had disappeared six weeks previously, and Vera has to break the news to her devastated family. However, the realisation that she died so close to home rather than at a music festival as originally thought creates tension among her neighbours, who are soon suspecting each other of murder. The detective delves into the vulnerable young woman's isolated existence to identify her killer

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan's plans for a romantic day at home are thwarted by Arthur's ramshackle motorbike, which unexpectedly breaks down on him. Comedy, with Reg Varney

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan and Jack are chosen to go on a training course. Comedy, starring Reg Varney and Bob Grant

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Pauline is all set to achieve her ambition when she is given the chance to join the Portwenn lifeboat crew. programme.title: Doc Martin

School secretary Maureen receives better news when what she thought was her thyroid problem turns out to be a pregnancy. Louisa calls Martin after Danny collapses - but the ambulance is delayed and emergency surgery must be performed to save his life

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective begins to suspect something is amiss when he visits one of his favoured haunts in London for dinner and discovers a fellow regular has dramatically changed his diet. Down in Brighton, elderly Anthony Gascoigne lies dying while his estranged twin brother Henry falls to his death - but nobody is sure whether the man was deliberately pushed. Bizarrely, the key to the riddle seems to lie in a blackberry pie. David Suchet stars in the title role, with Philip Jackson, Hugh Fraser and Pauline Moran

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: When the sleuth's dentist is found dead just minutes after he leaves his surgery, Chief Inspector Japp believes it to be suicide - but Poirot has reason to think otherwise and embarks on his own investigation. Drama, starring David Suchet

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: When a spate of petty thefts culminates in a series of murders at a student hostel, Miss Lemon persuades the Belgian sleuth to investigate. As ever, he receives support from Chief Inspector Japp. Mystery, starring David Suchet, with Philip Jackson, Pauline Moran, Damian Lewis and Paris Jefferson

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered sleuths are hired to work behind the scenes of a garden makeover TV show, but Rosemary has an accident while standing in for the programme's star and ends up in hospital. Realising someone is trying to sabotage the series, Laura teams up with no-nonsense presenter Quinnie Dorell (Belinda Lang) to catch the culprit. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are hired to create a restaurant garden on Italy's Ligurian coast, but it is not long before their working holiday is disrupted by a murder. Determined to solve the crime before returning home, they find themselves with no shortage of suspects - and matters are complicated further by a second death. Guest starring Suzanne Bertish (Rome) and Tristan Gemmill (Casualty), with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Singer-songwriter KT Tunstall always knew she was adopted and in 1998 was reunited with her birth mother, who told her that her father never wanted to give her up - a message that has inspired her to find out what happened to him. Brother and sister Simon Munro and Carole Killick grew up apart after their mother left when they were young in the 1960s, but the siblings were reunited more than 20 years ago and are now searching for their mother. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Silk Road Adventure
programme.desc: As her Silk Road journey continues, Joanna travels to the Islamic Republic of Iran, where she meets many people eager to share the culture and innovations of the Persian civilisation, which spread far beyond modern day Iran. From ancient water gardens created to be paradise on Earth, through desert cities, endless bazaars and majestic mosques, Joanna discovers a country brimming with hospitality and warmth. Her Iranian adventure finishes in the Persian Empire's ancient ceremonial capital, Persepolis

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Detective drama set in a 1950s Cambridgeshire village, where local vicar Sidney Chambers (James Norton) develops a sideline in sleuthing - with the initially reluctant help of grumpy DI Geordie Keating (Robson Green). The cleric's first case finds him presiding over the funeral of a solicitor, who is believed to have taken his own life. However, the dead man's mistress has a different theory - and feeling unable to go to the police, she asks Sidney to examine it for her. He uncovers evidence that the suicide was staged, but while he's busy delving into the personal life of the victim, will the vicar miss his own big chance with Amanda Kendall (Morven Christie), the woman he secretly loves? With Tessa Peake-Jones, Kacey Ainsworth and Rachel Shelley

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Poor Sidney. His sister Jen bullies him into attending Amanda's engagement dinner - seeing the love of his life celebrate her betrothal to another man is the last thing the village vicar wants. He sinks a few too many drinks in a bid to make the evening more palatable, but it doesn't work - in fact, nobody at the event seems happy. Tensions rise between Amanda and Jen's old school friends, and then matters erupt when Jen's boyfriend Johnny (Ukweli Roach, Starlings) is accused of stealing Amanda's engagement ring. Later, the unfortunate chap is accused of murdering one of his fellow guests, and evidence at the scene of the crime seems to back up the theory. But Sidney isn't convinced - can he unmask the real killer?

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Elizabeth longs for a baby, but Lawrence is incapable of consummating their marriage and asks Sir Edwin Partridge to step in and help save it. Nicola Pagett and Gordon Jackson star

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Elizabeth spends Christmas apart from Lawrence, confessing her sorrows to her parents, but a surprise lies in store for the Bellamys. Meanwhile, tension brews between Hudson and Thomas. Nicola Pagett and Gordon Jackson star

programme.desc: Naomi has a plan to help Ethan. Bob attempts to keep the peace. Bear tries to get Paddy back on the horse

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan and Jack tease Blakey about the obvious attention he is receiving from the canteen girl

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Pauline is all set to achieve her ambition when she is given the chance to join the Portwenn lifeboat crew. However, her joy is short-lived when she discovers the chauvinistic tendencies of her shipmates. Martin is accused of murder by the husband of a woman who died in his care. The irate man resorts to sabotaging Aunt Joan's crops in retaliation but an unexpected twist reveals the true motivation for his ire

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The doctor is surprised when his parents visit out of the blue, but they bring unwelcome tidings for all, especially Aunt Joan, who may be driven from her home. School secretary Maureen receives better news when what she thought was her thyroid problem turns out to be a pregnancy. Louisa calls Martin after Danny collapses - but the ambulance is delayed and emergency surgery must be performed to save his life

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective begins to suspect something is amiss when he visits one of his favoured haunts in London for dinner and discovers a fellow regular has dramatically changed his diet. Down in Brighton, elderly Anthony Gascoigne lies dying while his estranged twin brother Henry falls to his death - but nobody is sure whether the man was deliberately pushed. Bizarrely, the key to the riddle seems to lie in a blackberry pie. David Suchet stars in the title role, with Philip Jackson, Hugh Fraser and Pauline Moran

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: When the sleuth's dentist is found dead just minutes after he leaves his surgery, Chief Inspector Japp believes it to be suicide - but Poirot has reason to think otherwise and embarks on his own investigation. Drama, starring David Suchet

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: When a spate of petty thefts culminates in a series of murders at a student hostel, Miss Lemon persuades the Belgian sleuth to investigate. As ever, he receives support from Chief Inspector Japp. Mystery, starring David Suchet, with Philip Jackson, Pauline Moran, Damian Lewis and Paris Jefferson

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered sleuths are hired to work behind the scenes of a garden makeover TV show, but Rosemary has an accident while standing in for the programme's star and ends up in hospital. Realising someone is trying to sabotage the series, Laura teams up with no-nonsense presenter Quinnie Dorell (Belinda Lang) to catch the culprit. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are hired to create a restaurant garden on Italy's Ligurian coast, but it is not long before their working holiday is disrupted by a murder. Determined to solve the crime before returning home, they find themselves with no shortage of suspects - and matters are complicated further by a second death. Guest starring Suzanne Bertish (Rome) and Tristan Gemmill (Casualty), with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Singer-songwriter KT Tunstall always knew she was adopted and in 1998 was reunited with her birth mother, who told her that her father never wanted to give her up - a message that has inspired her to find out what happened to him. Brother and sister Simon Munro and Carole Killick grew up apart after their mother left when they were young in the 1960s, but the siblings were reunited more than 20 years ago and are now searching for their mother. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Silk Road Adventure
programme.desc: As her Silk Road journey continues, Joanna travels to the Islamic Republic of Iran, where she meets many people eager to share the culture and innovations of the Persian civilisation, which spread far beyond modern day Iran. From ancient water gardens created to be paradise on Earth, through desert cities, endless bazaars and majestic mosques, Joanna discovers a country brimming with hospitality and warmth. Her Iranian adventure finishes in the Persian Empire's ancient ceremonial capital, Persepolis

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Detective drama set in a 1950s Cambridgeshire village, where local vicar Sidney Chambers (James Norton) develops a sideline in sleuthing - with the initially reluctant help of grumpy DI Geordie Keating (Robson Green). The cleric's first case finds him presiding over the funeral of a solicitor, who is believed to have taken his own life. However, the dead man's mistress has a different theory - and feeling unable to go to the police, she asks Sidney to examine it for her. He uncovers evidence that the suicide was staged, but while he's busy delving into the personal life of the victim, will the vicar miss his own big chance with Amanda Kendall (Morven Christie), the woman he secretly loves? With Tessa Peake-Jones, Kacey Ainsworth and Rachel Shelley

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Poor Sidney. His sister Jen bullies him into attending Amanda's engagement dinner - seeing the love of his life celebrate her betrothal to another man is the last thing the village vicar wants. He sinks a few too many drinks in a bid to make the evening more palatable, but it doesn't work - in fact, nobody at the event seems happy. Tensions rise between Amanda and Jen's old school friends, and then matters erupt when Jen's boyfriend Johnny (Ukweli Roach, Starlings) is accused of stealing Amanda's engagement ring. Later, the unfortunate chap is accused of murdering one of his fellow guests, and evidence at the scene of the crime seems to back up the theory. But Sidney isn't convinced - can he unmask the real killer?

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Elizabeth longs for a baby, but Lawrence is incapable of consummating their marriage and asks Sir Edwin Partridge to step in and help save it. Nicola Pagett and Gordon Jackson star

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Elizabeth spends Christmas apart from Lawrence, confessing her sorrows to her parents, but a surprise lies in store for the Bellamys. Meanwhile, tension brews between Hudson and Thomas. Nicola Pagett and Gordon Jackson star

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: A report from Southeast Asia, of something in the water that's sliced cleanly through a young man's testicles, is enough to lure 'fishing detective' Jeremy Wade to the shores of the Mekong - a river long renowned for its monstrous fish. But what kind of creature could have inflicted such a distinctive, surgical wound? In his quest to expose the unseen mutilator, Jeremy uncovers multiple victims who've been mauled, half-blinded, and even fatally wounded by the same mysterious assailant - a baby-faced killer that appears to be proliferating

programme.title: The War Wagon (1967)
programme.desc: A convict is released from prison and swears vengeance on the corrupt mining contractor who took his gold-rich land. On the way, he encounters an old enemy who reveals that the gold from the mine is about to be transported in an armoured stagecoach - and suggests they join forces to steal it. Western, starring John Wayne, Kirk Douglas, Bruce Cabot and Howard Keel

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid

After Tang mentions the famed power of the Monkey King to duplicate himself, Monkie Kid decides to create clones so he can stay home and play video games after he has to do a lot of work for his friends - however, he doesn't know how to use his powers, and so the clones wreak havoc...

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: CGI-animated update of the classic children's cartoon from the 1980s. Inspector Gadget has finally defeated the cruel Dr Claw and frozen him in an iceberg in the Arctic north - however, his evil nephew Talon thaws him out and infiltrates HQ posing as an agent in training. Meanwhile, Penny has also become an agent in training and now has Brain as her assistant - the Chief then calls Penny to meet Talon, who is the agency's new recruit, and she instantly falls in love with him.

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: CGI-animated update of the classic children's cartoon from the 1980s. When Penny finds out that Dr Claw is back, she decides to put her Uncle Gadget back on the beat to find Claw's claw when it becomes clear that he's going to use it to destroy HQ. When Talon reveals his true intentions after finding out where Dr Claw's claw is, it's now up to Penny to stop MAD... with help from the amazing Inspector Gadget, of course!

programme.desc: Animated comedy series. While searching for a game console that Selina has confiscated, Mo finds two tickets for the 'Isaac the Psychic' show, but only one child's ticket! Lenny feels sorry for his buddy, but when he tries to console him, he makes things worse without meaning to. programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Chef Gino D'Acampo tours his homeland by train, taking in some of some of the most scenic train journeys in Europe. He begins in the French Alpine town of Breil-sur-Roya, so he can travel into Italy in style. Once in his own country, he meets a doctor who does his rounds on horseback, and visits hazelnut groves where he prepares a chocolate cheesecake. In Turin, he fulfils a lifelong dream of racing on top of the world-famous Lingotto rooftop track and makes his final dish - fettuccine pasta with mascarpone and pork mince

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: For the next leg of his journey, Gino D'Acampo boards an old steam train run by ex-railroad men and volunteers which takes him through the beautiful Tuscan countryside. His first stop is the town of Asciano, where locals try to compete with Siena's famous Palio horse race - only here they ride donkeys. Then it's on to the Chianti region where he visits a vineyard where they don't only make wine, but they also bathe in it too, an ancient tradition dating back to Roman times. After a luxurious wine bath, Gino cooks up a dish fit for any Emperor - farfalle pasta with funghi and spinach

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert grows tired of the lack of privacy at his parents' house and moves out, only to end up living with a couple who are uncannily similar to Marie and Frank

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa comes first in a writing competition and wins an all-expenses-paid trip to Washington - where her faith in the democratic process is shattered by the unseemly spectacle of a congressman accepting a bribe

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge enrols Bart in karate classes in a bid to reduce his weight. Ned Flanders opens a shop catering exclusively for left-handed customers - but Homer jinxes him by wishing for the venture to fail

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart becomes Fat Tony's personal errand boy and revels in the dubious prestige conferred by his new-found underworld connections - until he finds himself standing trial accused of murdering Principal Skinner

programme.desc: Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer are joined by Jordan Banjo and Perri Kiely from Diversity, who chat about the dance group's latest UK tour. programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer inadvertently saves Springfield from the consequences of a nuclear meltdown and becomes a local hero, but soon starts to feel like a fraud and grows tired of everyone congratulating him. Featuring the guest voices of 'Magic' Johnson and Jon Lovitz

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Krusty's father disowns him for becoming a comedian - much to the dismay of Lisa and Bart, who promptly try to bring about a reconciliation between the two stubborn men. With the guest voice of Jackie Mason

programme.desc: A hero is needed to defend a peaceful valley community from attack by a rampaging snow leopard. The unlikely candidate for the job is a lazy panda, who enlists the aid of a legendary team of animal fighters and their wise master to teach him the martial arts skills he needs to fulfil his destiny. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jack Black, Dustin Hoffman, Angelina Jolie, Ian McShane and Jackie Chan

programme.title: Scotland's Scenic Railways
programme.desc: Featuring a ride on the stunning West Highland line, where an ingenious 19th-century invention is still protecting Scotland's railway from rockfall. Plus, a look at the profit to be made from collecting old railway memorabilia, the team tasked with cleaning Britain's largest station roof at Edinburgh Waverley, and follow artist Leo du Feu, who paints castles from trains

programme.title: Matt Baker: Our Farm in the Dales
programme.desc: The Baker family awaits the arrival of the first generation of Herdwick lambs, and look forward to finally meeting the first pygmy goats to be born in the valley. Some unexpected visitors mean they require the assistance of beekeeper George, before Matt heads over to the restoration garage to lend a hand stripping down the rest of his dad's Dodge

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: The Andrew Neil Show
programme.desc: Political discussion show, featuring extended interviews with decision-takers and news-makers from across the political spectrum

programme.title: World's Most Secret Hotels
programme.desc: In New York, the TWA Hotel is close by the John F Kennedy International Airport. Its interiors hark back to the spirit of the 1960s jet age, but with a 21st-century twist. Here, visitors can check in at the old baggage check and enjoy dining in what used to be an airport lounge. In Finnish Lapland, visitors to the snow-capped forest of the Urho Kekkonen National Park can spend a night sleeping under the stars at the Kakslauttanen Arctic Resort. This getaway boasts 65 state-of-the-art, arctic-resistant glass igloos. There are also visits to unique and unusual hotels in Canada and Scotland

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: It's an illuminating week in the pottery, as the contenders make a table light with a continuous, embossed scene. In the second challenge, surprise guest judge - fashion and lifestyle designer Henry Holland - really tests their decadent design skills. Siobhán McSweeney hosts, with regular judges Keith Brymer Jones and Rich Miller setting the challenges

programme.title: Guy Martin's Great British Power Trip
programme.desc: As an energy crisis and cost of living crisis collide, the Lincolnshire lorry mechanic and motorcycle racer investigates the past, present and future of British power stations to work out how the country makes its most valuable commodity of all - electricity. This first episode begins with Guy testing every piece of equipment in his workshop to find out which items use the most electricity. Horrified by what he's now having to pay for power, he tries to work out the reasons behind his big bills, and visits his local power station at Drax - which also happens to be the country's biggest

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: The extraordinary story of Russia's covert attempts to corrupt British politics, influence government policy and undermine our democracy in the years before the invasion of Ukraine. Over the past 12 years, donors with links to Russia have poured millions into the coffers of the ruling Conservative Party. Dispatches reveals how senior politicians ignored the warnings about President Putin to the detriment of our national security, how political activists were encouraged to visit a Moscow strip club, and hears allegations concerning a Russian 'diplomat' seeking information from a government minister over a pint in a pub

programme.title: The Girl on the Train (2016)

She gets drawn into a web of intrigue when she becomes fascinated by a woman's disappearance. Rachel thinks she has vital evidence in cracking the case, but gaps in her memory cloud her judgment, and before long her own life is endangered. Thriller based on Paula Hawkins' novel, starring Emily Blunt, Rebecca Ferguson, Haley Bennett, Justin Theroux and Luke Evans

programme.title: A Hidden Life (2019)

In this live programme, Dan Walker explores the circumstances of her vanishing. He will speak to experts, those who know Nicola, and the police. programme.title: Cilla Black: The Queen of Saturday Night
programme.desc: The story of Cilla Black, who rose from working-class roots in Liverpool to become one of the nation's most successful and best-loved singers, presenters and all-round entertainers. programme.title: Queen Mary: How She Saved the Royals
programme.desc: Documentary about Elizabeth II's grandmother, who as Queen Consort was George V's most trusted adviser and became a symbol of national stability, particularly during the crisis that ensued when her eldest son Edward VIII abdicated. The programme examines her background prior to marriage and her continuing influence on the modern-day House of Windsor, with royal experts and historians revealing how Queen Mary's devotion to her duty and her country always came before her personal emotions

programme.title: Before They Were Royal
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the surprising and colourful life of the Queen Consort. This film charts Charles and Camilla's rollercoaster relationship, from the moment they met, through the Diana years, to their own marriage in Windsor in 2005

programme.title: Secrets of the Royal Palaces
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes tales of St James's Palace, which was built between 1531 and 1536 on the orders of Henry VIII and is the business centre of the royal family. There is a look at the history of Fabergé eggs, of which the Royal Collection contains three, and Kate Williams explores more gruesome stories of palace history, including the horrific story of what happened to Catherine Parr's body, and how giving birth in a palace became a spectator sport

programme.title: Frank Bough: National Treasure, National Disgrace
programme.desc: The story of Frank Bough's remarkable career and its dramatic ups and downs, woven together with a mixture of archive, dramatic reconstructions and talking heads. Key contributors include broadcasters Anne Diamond, Jeremy Vine, Vanessa Feltz and Janet Street-Porter. Bough was one of Britain's favourite personalities before he was brought down by one of the 1980s' biggest celebrity scandals. TV's 'Mr Clean' had a secret life, and his broadcasting career wouldn't recover

Mystery, starring Candace Cameron Bure, Yannick Bisson and Marilu Henner

Supernatural family drama based on Nicholas Wilde's novel, starring George Cole, Prunella Scales, Jon Newman and Rebecca Weeks

Supernatural family drama based on Nicholas Wilde's novel, starring George Cole, Prunella Scales, Jon Newman and Rebecca Weeks

programme.desc: As the bombs fall on London during the Blitz, writer Agatha Christie decides it is time to kill off Hercule Poirot - her most famous creation. She decides to sell the novel featuring the Belgian sleuth's death to a private buyer, a superfan who will pay a fortune to own a piece of history and keep the beloved detective alive. Mystery, starring Helen Baxendale

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Drain the Oceans
programme.desc: By making comparisons with the deepest lake on Earth _ Lake Baikal in the mountainous Russian region of Siberia _ combined with military-grade scanning technology and a sonar curtain drawn across its entire surface, the plug is pulled on the mystery of Scotland's famous loch. As the waters drain away, more than a monster is revealed

programme.title: Dinosaur with Stephen Fry
programme.desc: The actor and writer is magically transported back in time to chart the 180-million-year story of the prehistoric creatures, beginning by going back 155 million years to the Jurassic period. He explores the conifer forests and fern prairies that were their home, encountering a monstrous plant-eating diplodocus and deadly predator the allosaurus. Expert Susie Maidment arrives to decode these dinosaurs' remarkable behaviour, including the diplodocus's acrobatic ability to rear up on its hind legs and the allosaurus's terrifying attack strategy

programme.title: 22 Kids & Counting
programme.desc: With the energy crisis hitting the Radford household, 13-year-old Max puts his maths skills to good use and comes up with some extreme money-saving tips. Meanwhile, Chloe is on maternity leave from the bakery and she and partner Jake are feeling the financial pinch, so he decides to try his hand at modelling

programme.title: The Cruise: Welcome Aboard!
programme.desc: Nicole is keen to make some friends to party with, but travelling alone brings challenges and she must figure things out for herself when she gets lost looking for a place to relax. The ship docks in the busy port of Marina di Carrara in Italy and the pressure is on Shore Things manager Nico to make sure every passenger who wants to disembark for a day trip is on the right bus, while front of house manager Dane goes undercover to check out one of the excursions

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Yorkshire lads and cousins John and Jamie head to Fuengirola market, while Clint Valentine is looking for some extra money working at a bar

programme.title: Most Shocking Celebrity Moments
programme.desc: Memorable incidents involving Hollywood A-listers, from the sofa-bouncing antics of Tom Cruise on Oprah to Mark Wahlberg's exhausting and unbelievable daily routine. The programme looks at the feud between Justin Bieber and Orlando Bloom, an examines why Dwayne 'the Rock' Johnson took against Vin Diesel during filming on the Fast and Furious franchise

programme.title: The LeoVegas Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: The Yorkshire Steam Railway: All Aboard
programme.desc: War Weekend takes place on the North York Moors Railway, celebrating the part played by the railways during the Second World War, with around 30,000 visitors expected to attend. As it turns out, the biggest battle of the weekend is with the weather, as a storm blights the final preparations. Further complications arise when a tree falls on the line, leading to a full track inspection before any trains are allowed to run. Despite the setbacks, can the team pull off one of their biggest, most important and lucrative events of the year?

programme.title: Paddington Station 24/7
programme.desc: News of a major incident comes through to Swindon control room, with a fatality on the line at Slough station leading to a line closure to allow for the emergency services. In another incident, mobile operations manager George goes to meet the owner of a scrapyard, which has fallen victim to thieves who have stolen thousands of pounds' worth of goods and used the railway track to get away

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow presents the life and work of the Western world's most gifted artists, beginning with Giotto di Bondone, the son of a Tuscan shepherd. Born in 1267, Giotto began his apprenticeship at the age of 12, and with his naturalistic treatment of medieval Christian iconography, was recognised as the first in a line of great painters and architects who contributed to the Italian Renaissance

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Compilation of highlights from the home improvement series, featuring bedroom and bathroom makeovers by Californian designer Ann Maurice

programme.title: Peppa Pig
