programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Daring Danny X takes his horse off the trail and ends up on a wild ride

programme.title: Pip and Posy
programme.desc: The pair play against Frankie and Zac in a football match

programme.title: The Stranger (1946)
programme.desc: A Nazi war criminal masquerades as a college professor in an American town, while a government official is intent on tracking him down. Drama, directed by and starring Orson Welles, with Loretta Young and Edward G Robinson

programme.title: Dead Reckoning (1947)
programme.desc: A veteran paratrooper is drawn into a web of murder, gambling and blackmail by the former girlfriend of an comrade, who went missing from a train while the men were on their way to awarded medals in a ceremony in Washington. Film noir murder mystery, starring Humphrey Bogart, Lizabeth Scott, William Prince and Morris Carnovsky

programme.title: The Banshees of Inisherin Interview Special
programme.desc: The In Bruges team of Colin Farrell, Brendan Gleeson and writer/director Martin McDonagh talk about making their new film together, The Banshees of Inisherin

programme.title: Tomahawk (1951)
programme.desc: Frontier scout Jim Bridger doesn't approve when a gold rush leads the US army to build a fort on land occupied by the Sioux. The situation goes from bad to worse when a sadistic officer launches an unprovoked attack, prompting a vengeful tribe to go on the offensive and leaving Bridger the only one who can save the soldiers at the fort from certain death. Western, starring Van Hefting, Yvonne de Carlo and Alex Nicol, and featuring an early appearance by Rock Hudson

programme.title: The Wrong Box (1966)
programme.desc: Two elderly brothers each stand to inherit a fortune if the other dies first - but one of them is not prepared to leave anything to chance, and begins a series of disastrous attempts on his unsuspecting sibling's life. However, when one of the pair appears to have really died, his nephews conspire to cover it up. Black comedy, with John Mills, Ralph Richardson, Michael Caine, Peter Cook and Dudley Moore

programme.title: Eye in the Sky (2015)
programme.desc: Colonel Katherine Powell's mission to wipe out a terrorist cell in Kenya is complicated when a girl enters the blast radius of the intended drone strike. Powell has to decide between sacrificing the girl's life or letting the terrorists flee to carry out more atrocities. Thriller, starring Helen Mirren, Alan Rickman and Aaron Paul

programme.title: The Banshees of Inisherin Interview Special
programme.desc: The In Bruges team of Colin Farrell, Brendan Gleeson and writer/director Martin McDonagh talk about making their new film together, The Banshees of Inisherin

programme.title: Planes, Trains and Automobiles (1987)
programme.desc: A stressed businessman just wants to make it home to spend Thanksgiving with his family. However, when his flight is forced to land miles from its destination, he finds himself sharing a disaster-strewn journey across America with an amiable but slobbish salesman. Comedy road movie, starring Steve Martin, John Candy, Laila Robins, Kevin Bacon and Michael McKean

programme.title: The Long Good Friday (1980)
programme.desc: A ruthless London crime lord tries to extend his dockland empire by exploring business opportunities in America. When his organisation is the target of a series of bombings, he discovers a mysterious syndicate is trying to muscle in on his territory, and resorts to increasingly brutal methods to expose the culprits. Wonderful gritty thriller, starring Bob Hoskins, Helen Mirren, Dave King and Bryan Marshall. Look out for Pierce Brosnan and Casualty's Derek Thompson in supporting roles

programme.title: High-Rise (2015)
programme.desc: A doctor secures himself a new home in a luxurious apartment complex, where residents are able to shut out the rest of the world. As society begins to break down in the face of failing infrastructure, tension erupts between residents of different floors, leading to a literal class war. Ben Wheatley's satirical thriller based on JG Ballard's novel, starring Tom Hiddleston, Jeremy Irons, Sienna Miller and Luke Evans

programme.title: The Muppets Take Manhattan (1984)
programme.desc: Kermit, Miss Piggy, Fozzie Bear and company try to take Broadway by storm with their college show, setting the stage for a host of misadventures as they yearn for stardom in the Big Apple and set out to raise the money to finance their production. Comedy, performed by Jim Henson and Frank Oz, with appearances by Liza Minnelli, Art Carney, Dabney Coleman, Gregory Hines, Joan Rivers, Brooke Shields, Linda Lavin and Elliott Gould

programme.title: Monster House (2006)
programme.desc: A boy becomes obsessed with a sinister elderly neighbour living in a creepy old house. On Halloween night, he and two friends discover the chilling truth - the house is alive and eats anything that comes too close, including children. Animated comedy horror, with the voices of Mitchel Musso, Sam Lerner, Spencer Locke, Steve Buscemi, Maggie Gyllenhaal and Jason Lee

programme.title: The Addams Family (1991)
programme.desc: Creepy couple Morticia and Gomez find their unconventional life threatened by a man claiming to be a long-lost relative. When they welcome him with open arms, they fall prey to a plot that could cost them their ancestral home and the family fortune. Black comedy based on the 1960s TV series, starring Anjelica Huston, Raul Julia, Christopher Lloyd, Christina Ricci, Jimmy Workman and Carel Struycken

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee (1986)
programme.desc: A New York reporter searches the Australian Outback for a maverick hunter with a legendary reputation, and invites the adventurer back to America. But the die-hard Aussie needs to draw on all his survival skills to adjust to life in the urban jungle. Comedy adventure, written by and starring Paul Hogan, with Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Mark Blum

programme.title: Star Trek Beyond (2016)
programme.desc: The USS Enterprise sets out on a rescue mission which turns out to be a deadly trap set by a mysterious warlord. The crew are left stranded on an unexplored planet, and join forces with a fugitive alien scavenger to find a way off the hostile world and prevent a terrible weapon being unleashed upon the galaxy. Sci-fi adventure, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto and Idris Elba

programme.title: The Girl in the Spider's Web (2018)
programme.desc: Swedish hacker Lisbeth Salander is hired by computer genius Frans Balder to retrieve Firefall, a programme capable of accessing the world's nuclear codes that he developed for the National Security Agency. Though Salander manages to find Firefall, it's not long before she's fighting for her life against mercenaries. Thriller, starring Claire Foy and Sylvia Hoeks

programme.title: Spell (2020)
programme.desc: A man crash-lands in rural Appalachia and awakens in the attic of a traditional Hoodoo practitioner. He desperately tries to break free from her dark magic and save his family from a sinister ritual, before the rise of the blood moon. Horror directed by former DJ Mark Tonderai, starring Omari Hardwick and Loretta Devine

programme.title: Atomic Blonde (2017)
programme.desc: MI6 operative Lorraine Broughton is sent to Berlin before the fall of the wall to investigate the murder of a fellow spy and recover a missing list of double agents. The city is in a dangerously unstable state, and she finds herself targetted by multiple factions plotting to exploit the uncertain future for their own ruthless ends. Thriller, starring Charlize Theron, James McAvoy and John Goodman

programme.title: Rugrats Go Wild (2003)
programme.desc: A leaky boat leaves the precocious youngsters stranded on a jungle island, but their luck changes when explorers the Wild Thornberrys come to their rescue. However, Thornberry dad Nigel loses his memory, so it falls to his daughter Eliza to save the day. Children's animated adventure, with the voices of Nancy Cartwright, Bruce Willis, Lacey Chabert, Elizabeth Daily and Tim Curry

programme.title: Rango (2011)
programme.desc: A pet chameleon with an active imagination ends up lost in the desert. He makes his way to a lawless town of animals, where he is mistaken for a deadly gunslinger and made sheriff. He organises the townsfolk into a posse when bandits led by an evil rattlesnake steal their supply of water. Oscar-winning animated comedy, with the voices of Johnny Depp, Isla Fisher and Bill Nighy

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader (2010)
programme.desc: Lucy and Edmund Pevensie return to the magical world accompanied by their selfish cousin. They join their old friend King Caspian as he sets sail across the sea in search of seven of his father's allies who had been banished years before, but along the way they discover an evil force is growing in strength. Fantasy adventure, with Georgie Henley, Skandar Keynes, Will Poulter and Ben Barnes

programme.title: Black Knight (2001)
programme.desc: An employee at a run-down medieval theme park suffers a nasty fall and knocks himself out - only to wake up in 14th-century England, where he gets up to all manner of mischief with the knights in shining armour and damsels in distress. Comedy adventure, starring Martin Lawrence, Tom Wilkinson and Marsha Thomason

programme.title: Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey (1991)
programme.desc: The would-be heavy metal superstars face the Grim Reaper as they try to reclaim their souls from Hell, return to the land of the living and stop their robot doppelgangers from changing history. Along the way, they must also master their instruments, so they can triumph at the Battle of the Bands. Comedy sequel, starring Keanu Reeves, Alex Winter, William Sadler, Joss Ackland and George Carlin

programme.title: Gangs of New York (2002)
programme.desc: An Irishman in 19th-century New York is taken under the wing of the ruthless gang leader who killed his father 15 years before, and rises up the ranks of power - all the while plotting his revenge. Meanwhile, the tension caused by the enforced drafting of the population into the army to fight in the Civil War explodes into bloodshed and riots. Martin Scorsese's epic historical drama, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Daniel Day-Lewis, Cameron Diaz and Liam Neeson

programme.title: Mid90s (2018)
programme.desc: During the 1990s in Los Angeles, 13-year-old Stevie spends his summer navigating between a troubled home life and a crew of new friends he meets at a skate shop. Writer/director Jonah Hill's comedy drama, starring Sunny Suljic, Katherine Waterston and Lucas Hedges

programme.title: Submarine (2010)
programme.desc: A 15-year-old boy determined to lose his virginity before he turns 16 becomes infatuated with a feisty classmate. He also has a more pressing mission to undertake as he tries to save his parents' failing marriage, despite his father's apathy and the return of his mother's smooth-talking ex. Comedy drama, with Craig Roberts, Sally Hawkins, Paddy Considine and Noah Taylor

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Ethan, Sienna and Grace come up with a plan to get rid of Warren and his mum. Later, Donna-Marie puts all her effort into trying to help her daughter

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Warren opens up to Norma about his love for Sienna. Later, Norma seeks help from Ethan and Sienna when she realises Grace has gone missing

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three of the restaurants he tried to save, Lido, Anna Vincenzo's and Le Bistro, to find out whether his advice has been put to good use

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for Pasadena, California, where he visits Jamaican-themed restaurant Cafe Kingston. The business in run by Dr Una Morris, a micro-managing owner who also works at a radiotherapy clinic next door, and is determined to introduce hospital-style techniques to the kitchen by sealing everything in plastic bags

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barry plans big romantic gestures for Lainey on high school prom night, while Erica and Geoff try to attend the event together, but things don't go as planned. Adam is thrilled when a nerdy but cute girl asks him out, but is horrified when Beverly gets involved

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barry attempts to drive a wedge between Adam and Pops when they debate the merits of a recently released Batman movie. Erica deliberately makes a mess of her interview at one university so that she will only receive an offer from her first choice of college, but her plan goes badly awry. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Hayley Orrantia

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When the guys are unable to get tickets for Comic-Con, Leonard, Howard and Raj decide to buy fake passes from a stranger - but they then worry about getting caught with them. Sheldon decides to hold his own comic-book convention and searches for a suitable star guest for the event. Meanwhile, the girls take tea at a hotel but discover that maturity is over-rated. Comedy, guest starring James Earl Jones and Carrie Fisher

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy take a train ride to the Napa Valley with Howard and Bernadette on Valentine's Day, while Leonard and Penny head to the vets when they volunteer to look after Raj's dog. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil and Claire have a massive falling out, and they are lent a friendly ear by Gloria and Jay respectively as they think about what went wrong. Cameron launches his Harp Attack fundraiser, and aims to outdo last year's event until Mitchell realises he forgot to post any invitations

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay worries his eventual death will allow Gloria to remarry, and decides to buy them both a crypt, ensuring they will be together for eternity. Meanwhile, Cameron makes a scrapbook to help Lily embrace her unconventional upbringing, Claire tries to play peacemaker when Alex accidentally rips Haley's favourite jumper, and Phil treats himself to a day at the spa

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta helps Santiago to navigate the complicated relationship that she has with her brother David. Boyle introduces some drama into an undercover mission involving Jeffords and Captain Holt

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: A visitor from Latvia causes Boyle and Peralta to begin investigating Nikolaj's family. Captain Holt and Santiago bring in famed forensic scientist Dr Yee to help close a difficult murder case for Diaz

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Howard plan respective birthday celebrations for Amy and Halley. A letter from his brother makes Leonard feel anxious about his own lack of accomplishments. The series takes a mid-season break until the new year.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy subject their friends to a series of secret tests to find out who is most qualified to act as best man and maid of honour at their wedding. Penny realises her true feelings about her friendship with Amy

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon becomes upset about his career, the destruction of the comic-book store and Leonard and Penny's future living arrangements. Elsewhere, Howard is unable to keep hold of a carer for his mother. Comedy, staring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Amy are forced to take an unexpected road trip to Arizona to pick up Sheldon after his epic railway journey ends in chaos. Meanwhile, Howard finds Stuart's relationship with his mother strange, and Penny has an interview for a sales job at Bernadette's workplace. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitch and Cam try to get Lily on their side when they decide to adopt a baby boy, but have doubts about whether they are adequately prepared to raise another child. Meanwhile, Gloria deals with Manny's head teacher

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cam and Mitch go on diets, and Phil is inspired to try his hand at tightrope walking. Meanwhile, Claire tries to plant ideas in the heads of her warring daughters, and Jay's behaviour grates on Gloria

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: A new captain at the Nine-Nine attempts to ingratiate herself with Jake and the squad by inviting them over to her house for a dinner party

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Adrian Pimento shows up unexpectedly to seek Jake and Charles' help after claiming someone is trying to kill him. The rest of the squad endures a Workplace Conflict seminar

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard returns from his space mission, but the welcome from his friends and family does not meet his expectations. On top of that, Sheldon, Amy, Leonard and Penny kick him out of their group games night. Comedy, starring Simon Helberg

programme.desc: Stuart hosts a Halloween party at the comic-book store, and Howard talks incessantly about his work on board the International Space Station, annoying his wife and friends. Penny and Leonard have a steamy encounter at the lab. Guest starring real-life astronaut Buzz Aldrin

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon isn't pleased by the newfound popularity of Stuart's comic book shop when an author puts the place on the map. When Raj attempts to take the credit for Penny's astronomical discovery, friendships are tested. Howard and Bernadette try to arrange a date night

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon goes to Las Vegas and does everything he can to win a large sum of money for science. Meanwhile, Penny and Bernadette take Amy shopping for a wedding dress, but her terrible choice entangles them in a web of lies

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Diane feels ignored by Tony, and Warren's attempts to win his children's affections end up backfiring. Elsewhere, two old lovers hide their true feelings

programme.desc: TV presenter AJ Odudu plans to wow the fellow celebs with a menu from her Nigerian-Lancashire roots in the hope of bagging the grand for charity. Cue some are biscuit comparisons and the group members discovering each other's worst childhood moments - with celeb coming clean about their prized collection of photos that got them in big trouble and another declaring they weren't always a goody-two-shoes

The business in run by Dr Una Morris, a micro-managing owner who also works at a radiotherapy clinic next door, and is determined to introduce hospital-style techniques to the kitchen by sealing everything in plastic bags

programme.title: The Goldbergs

However, Murray's strategy soon backfires, causing issues in his relationship with Beverly. Meanwhile, as Lainey visits Erica at college, Barry aims to get back together with her

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Murray's furniture shop faces competition from a rival with an attention-grabbing advertising campaign, so Adam offers to make his father a television commercial starring Marvin. When Barry's attempts to court a girl at school end in failure, Beverly steps in with some advice that works a little too well

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Groom-to-be Chris decides to turn his wedding into the ultimate obstacle course, but his fiancee Charlotte dreams of a wedding day filled with family tradition

programme.title: Supernanny US
programme.desc: Jo Frost helps Crystal Tobeck and Jeff Lawrence, who doubled their family overnight when they got together, bringing kids from previous marriages under one roof

programme.title: Lego Masters Australia
programme.desc: The teams are challenged to create a bridge that can survive two shaking plates. If more than one bridge can survive all 12 levels of shaking, then the best-looking bridge will win

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay uses his wealth of experience in the restaurant business to help struggling hotels, motels and B&Bs across America. After identifying the most pressing issues at each location, he puts the owners and staff to work as he attempts to save their establishments from disaster. His first stop is Coeur d'Alene, Idaho, where the Roosevelt Inn is more than $1million in debt - and to make matters worse, the owner's wife has had enough

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits the allegedly haunted Cambridge Hotel in New York, run by former military man John Imhof and his wife Tina. John runs the business like a dictatorship - an approach that is upsetting staff and sending guests straight for the exits. Will the chef be able to use his experience in the restaurant business to save this struggling establishment from disaster?

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gordon Ramsay heads to Windsor, Vermont, on a mission to boost the fortunes of the Juniper Hill Inn, which may look impressive, but smells of raw sewage owing to a plumbing problem. After meeting the B&B's wealthy owner Robert Dean II, the chef uncovers some shocking treatment toward staff and realises he will need something approaching a miracle to save this business from disaster

programme.title: Hotel for Dogs (2009)
programme.desc: An orphaned brother and sister face losing their beloved dog when they go into a foster home that does not allow pets. The kids find the ideal hiding place in an abandoned hotel, and set about transforming it into luxury canine accommodation for not just their beloved pet, but every stray in town. Family comedy, starring Emma Roberts, Jake T Austin, Don Cheadle and Lisa Kudrow

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Manny reopens Mitchell's old childhood wound when he takes up fencing, with support from Jay and the rest of the family, and Phil tries to find out if Luke has any hidden talents. American comedy, starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire determines to give Phil the perfect anniversary present and lose her reputation for offering bad gifts, so she hires one of their favourite musicians for a private performance. Mitchell and Cam's party girl friend Sal comes to visit. Guest starring Edward Norton and Elizabeth Banks

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys try to throw Luke the birthday party of his dreams, but Cameron's ill-fated efforts as Fizbo the clown result in a trip to A&E. American comedy, starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: With the children behaving boisterously, Claire and Phil threaten to cancel their Christmas celebrations, and Lily is taken to see Santa. Starring Julie Bowen and Ty Burrell

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Manny's biological father visits, and Jay's reaction to him lands him in trouble with Gloria. Meanwhile, Claire relies on a fireman to get Phil to the hospital for kidney stone treatment and Lily is sleep-trained by her doting dads. Starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny buys Leonard and Sheldon some Star Trek action figures, but the duo refuse to remove them from the packaging in case their value is diminished. Elsewhere, Raj is desperate to find someone to accompany him to a wedding and asks his parents to find him a date. Featuring the guest voice of Leonard Nimoy

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard is put in charge of looking after Stephen Hawking's wheelchair when the famous scientist comes to lecture at the university for a week - and takes advantage of his position to blackmail Sheldon into performing assorted unpleasant tasks. Guest starring Stephen Hawking

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Sheldon and Raj organise a stag party for Howard, but stories about his sexual history are unwittingly revealed, and he has to persuade bride-to-be Bernadette not to call off the wedding. Comedy, starring Simon Helberg and Kunal Nayyar

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard tries to use his wedding as an excuse to avoid being sent into space, but ends up accepting the mission. Amy plots to get Sheldon to take the next step in their relationship, while Leonard accidentally asks Penny to marry him

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow (2004)
programme.desc: A climatologist warns global warming will soon result in destructive freak weather, or even another ice age. He thinks the world still has time to prepare for the worst, but the crisis happens almost immediately - and as storms, earthquakes and hurricanes strike in terrifying fashion, he races across America to rescue his son from a frozen New York. Disaster thriller, with Jake Gyllenhaal and Dennis Quaid

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Denise Van Outen and her partner Eddie, Nick Grimshaw and his niece Liv, Zoe Ball and her son Woody Cook, Martin Kemp and son Roman Kemp, Maureen Lipman and Gyles Brandreth, Johnny Vegas and his PA Bev, Emilia Fox and Joanna David, Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford and Laura Whitmore and Iain Stirling offer sharp, insightful, funny and sometimes emotional critiques of Bake Off: The Professionals, Ramsay's 24 Hours to Hell and Back, Celebrity MasterChef, The Supervet: Noel Fitzpatrick, Grease and Thelma & Louise

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, with cameras capturing their instant reactions to I Can See Your Voice, Emmerdale, Strictly Come Dancing, Unbreakable, The Ex-Wife, Bargain Hunt, and news coverage of the new Chancellor

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on various show from the past week, including Michael McIntyre's The Wheel, Jamie's £1 Wonders, Top Gear, Guillermo del Toro's Cabinet of Curiosities, Drink Masters, Wild Croc Territory, plus the woman marrying a ghost on This Morning and BBC News reporting on the new 50p coin

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: American-born 32-year-old magazine editor Alex arrives sporting blazing blue hair, but is nervous about how her date will react when she reveals the reasons behind her unique new look. Her date, 33-year-old professional storyteller Will, can speak to thousands of people at once without worry - but do the nerves hit when he's one on one with his date? Teacher Masackia, who's 29, doesn't want exotic food on her plate but she would like an exotic man. Her date with 41-year-old Dieter might be a lesson in love as they learn about each other's nuances and share stories from their pasts, but as differences begin to appear, will their date pass its final test?

programme.title: Summer House
programme.desc: There is a massive luau on the final weekend, and Ashley's husband arrives just as everyone is at odds with each other

programme.title: Summer House
programme.desc: Reality series following a group of attractive and wealthy young professionals as they head to New York's desirable Hamptons district for the summer

programme.title: Summer House
programme.desc: Reality series following a group of attractive and wealthy young professionals as they head to New York's desirable Hamptons district for the summer

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay uses his wealth of experience in the restaurant business to help struggling hotels, motels and B&Bs across America. After identifying the most pressing issues at each location, he puts the owners and staff to work as he attempts to save their establishments from disaster. His first stop is Coeur d'Alene, Idaho, where the Roosevelt Inn is more than $1million in debt - and to make matters worse, the owner's wife has had enough

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits the allegedly haunted Cambridge Hotel in New York, run by former military man John Imhof and his wife Tina. John runs the business like a dictatorship - an approach that is upsetting staff and sending guests straight for the exits. Will the chef be able to use his experience in the restaurant business to save this struggling establishment from disaster?

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Extended edition of the soap

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube
programme.desc: Comedy clips showcasing amusing internet videos, including cats 'singing' the Star Wars theme tune and an escaped honey badger

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gordon Ramsay continues to uncover problems at the Juniper Hill Inn in Windsor, Vermont. The chef tries to help the staff communicate with owners Robert and Ari, but after he catches one of them telling a shocking lie, will it be the final straw?

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to the River Rock Inn in Milford, Pennsylvania, where owner Ken Pisciotta is struggling to attract guests and battling huge debts. He has all but given up and his constant negativity is rubbing off on the staff. Can Gordon get this establishment back on track before Ken loses everything?

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Supercar fanatic Eddie Kaen has spent millions on the design of the Keating in San Diego, California, but neglected to invest in things the guests really need. Gordon Ramsay's visit uncovers empty rooms, a failing restaurant and staff at the end of their tether - leading to a shocking crisis that nobody saw coming

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay visits Meson de Mesilla, a Tuscan-style hotel in Las Cruces, New Mexico. Owner and former child-star Cali Szczawinski purchased the hotel so she could perform Cher songs every night to a captive audience, but Gordon investigates whether she may be falling flat when it comes to the needs of her guests because she's too busy trying to hit the high notes on stage

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: As Howard and his fellow astronauts sit in the space shuttle awaiting launch, he reflects on the tumultuous events of the previous few days, when he and Bernadette tried to get married. Meanwhile, his friends witness the blast-off on TV at home

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Despite being on the International Space Station, Howard gets caught in a strange argument between Bernadette and his mother via video link. Elsewhere, Raj feels lonely while his best friend is away and ends up interfering with Sheldon's and Leonard's dates. Comedy, starring Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny tells the girls she is unsure about her relationship with Leonard and is considering breaking up with him, but when Sheldon finds out, he tries his best to change her mind. Meanwhile, on the International Space Station, Howard is being bullied by the other astronauts. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon hires an attractive female assistant, but when she becomes interested in Leonard, Penny decides to mark her territory by sleeping with him. Meanwhile, Howard starts to lose his mind when his return from space is delayed another week. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard returns from his space mission, but the welcome from his friends and family does not meet his expectations. His night alone with Bernadette goes badly, his mother ignores him, and he realises Stuart has taken his place as Raj's best friend. On top of that, Sheldon, Amy, Leonard and Penny kick him out of their group games night. Comedy, starring Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Stuart hosts a Halloween party at the comic-book store, and Howard talks incessantly about his work on board the International Space Station, annoying his wife and friends. Penny and Leonard have a steamy encounter at the lab. Guest starring real-life astronaut Buzz Aldrin

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny makes an important decision after Leonard tries to help her in the aftermath of a failed role on a TV show. Meanwhile, Raj and Stuart practise talking to strangers at a shopping centre, and Sheldon studies to become a comic genius. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon tries to relax after he is forced to take a holiday, and when Penny quits her job the duo end up spending time together. Meanwhile, Leonard struggles to be supportive of his girlfriend's career decision, Bernadette seeks Stuart's help in replacing one of Howard's comic books, and Howard and Raj provide Amy with some advice. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When the guys are unable to get tickets for Comic-Con, Leonard, Howard and Raj decide to buy fake passes from a stranger - but they then worry about getting caught with them. Sheldon decides to hold his own comic-book convention and searches for a suitable star guest for the event. Meanwhile, the girls take tea at a hotel but discover that maturity is over-rated. Comedy, guest starring James Earl Jones and Carrie Fisher

programme.title: Lego Masters Australia
programme.desc: The seven remaining teams are challenged to build tiny dragons that are small enough to be carried on a drone, with the winner getting an advantage for the second build

programme.title: Evolution (2001)
programme.desc: Two science teachers investigate a mysterious meteor and discover it is oozing a strange fluid containing millions of minuscule but rapidly evolving organisms - which start to turn into terrifying alien monsters with a taste for human flesh. Sci-fi comedy, starring David Duchovny, Orlando Jones, Julianne Moore, Seann William Scott, Dan Aykroyd and Ted Levine

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout (2018)
programme.desc: Ethan Hunt and the IMF team join forces with CIA assassin August Walker to prevent a disaster caused by mysterious arms dealer John Lark and a group of terrorists known as the Apostles. However, Hunt and his colleagues are soon pushed to their limits thanks to a face from their past. Writer/director Christopher McQuarrie's sixth entry in the action thriller saga, starring Tom Cruise and Henry Cavill

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Some of the most memorable TV moments from March 2018, including Sport Relief, Top Gear, Bodyguard, Come Home and Great Indian Railway Journeys, get a grilling from the armchair critics

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson welcomes 45-year-old twice-divorced Nicola, who is hoping one of the six naked men behind the screens has what it takes to be husband number three. Second up is Mark from London, who has Crohn's disease and hopes to regain some body confidence on the show

programme.title: Summer House
programme.desc: Fireworks continue as the 4 July party winds down. Lindsay reconnects with Everett. Kyle and Amanda work together on their new start-up

programme.title: Summer House
programme.desc: Danielle forgives Jordan, but he continues to wreak havoc in the house, leading his housemates to question who he really is. Kyle makes a romantic gesture to woo Amanda

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Extended edition of the soap

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp introduces new crafts, skills and techniques for interior decoration. In this edition, she reveals how to create a personalised doormat and coasters, using spray paint, old tiles and serviettes

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sun-worshippers Carol and Junior Smith have cashed in their savings and cannot wait to buy a holiday home where they can spend more quality time as a family. With a budget of £70,000, Jonnie Irwin shows them five properties near the popular Mar Menor in the south-east of Spain. Will they go for a bungalow with a rooftop terrace or a spacious townhouse that has them lost for words?

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: As the season draws to a close, the Brits abroad reflect on a strange summer. In Spain, a guest house tries to tempt Spanish visitors with local cuisine and a cycling retreat wins some much-needed business, while a Portuguese holiday village takes delivery of a massive new centrepiece

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Max McMurdo and Simon O'Brien are in Woking, Surrey, where they find a sidecar - to be transformed into a boat - and a water cylinder that Simon might make into a trendy lamp

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Herefordshire to meet former farmer Julian. Henry finds an old cattle feeder that he wants to turn into a garden bench, while Simon hatches plans to turn a vintage seed drill into a trendy dining table

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The competition is on as the team endeavour to crack a new treasury case before a rival firm gets there first. With family lines leading nowhere, the team's research takes an interesting tack when records lead to India

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The latest competition starts in Filey, North Yorkshire, at The White Lodge Hotel, where hosts James and Kim Hodgson hope their love of luxury and high standards will impress their guests. During an afternoon at the lifeboat station, Kerry and Nicola from Camp Katur reveal their competitive nature. At dinner, there are differences of opinions between the guests. James and Kim find some home truths in their feedback,but insist they won't lower themselves to tit for tat

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Amanda Lucia-Charley and her friend Alan Talbot invite the other hoteliers to sample the delights of Crystals on the Prom in Blackpool, where Alan introduces his alter-ego Ada

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Old Red Lion Country Inn in Upper Poppleton, North Yorkshire, where Mark and Jean Lee hope their plain and simple pub B&B will impress their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest ends at glamping site Camp Katur in Kirklington, North Yorkshire, where Kerry Roy and Nicola Wilding hope to wow their guests with their unique 'geodomes' and see-through pods

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the contest arrives, and while Amanda Lucia-Charley and Alan Talbot receive harsh criticism of their breakfast, Mark and Jean Lee's decor receives scathing reviews

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is in the Home Counties with Harvie and Ranjit, who have had one of the longest searches she has ever tried to crack. With a staggering £1.6m budget, it seems like it should be simple but the couple confess to having viewed and rejected nearly 100 properties. Phil Spencer has a challenge of a different sort. Zosia and David have saved hard for their first home and have been living Zosia's parents while they search. They have their hearts set on the popular town of Hitchin and Phil thinks that might be partly why their £380,000 remains unspent

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet the Olliers from Stenhousemuir in Scotland, where husband and wife Steven and Mhairi are undecided whether to sell their home or renovate it. Kirstie produces a plan that revolutionises the whole house, while Phil is tasked to find them a home that's a short throw away from their beloved cricket club

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton is on the Greek island of Corfu, house-hunting with childhood sweethearts Simon and Andrea from Manchester. The couple have two sons and two young grandsons who they cannot wait to share a holiday home on the island with. As Simon and Andrea plan to retire there, the pressure is on Laura to show them five suitable properties for their £75,000 budget

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: Siobhan McSweeney takes the remaining potters up on the roof to create gargoyles, and guest judge Gabriel Nichols, from William Blyth Roof Tiles, challenges the group to make a chimney pot. Judges Keith Brymer Jones and Rich Miller must then decide who will be named potter of the week, and who will be cast out of the pottery

programme.title: The Wall: Cover Your Tracks
programme.desc: Detective Céline Trudeau is assigned to investigate a strange homicide that has taken place in Fermont, a small mining town on the Labrador border. The body of a young woman has been found in a ventilation shaft with a mask concealing her identity. Upon arrival, Trudeau discovers 'The Wall', a massive structure protecting the town from the Arctic winds. The whole town is under suspicion over the death, while Celine is thrust into further uncertainty by an upsetting meeting with a face from her past. Canadian mystery drama, starring Isabel Richer and Alexandre Landry. In French

programme.title: The Wall: Cover Your Tracks
programme.desc: Celine and Alexandre work hard on the case, questioning anyone that they can connect to the victim Justine, especially at her workplace - the main bar for the town. They discover that Justine left a bar with a stranger. The hunt is on. Canadian mystery drama, starring Isabel Richer and Alexandre Landry. In French

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Schoolboy Eddie, 12, is brought into A&E having been hit by a car on his way home from school, and doctors are concerned he may have suffered a bleed on the brain, as well as damage to his kidneys. Meanwhile, 64-year-old Linda, who breathes with the help of a tracheostomy, arrives at King's after experiencing respiratory failure at home, and student Amy, 20, has been coughing up blood

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Doctors are concerned that 38-year-old Stacie may be paralysed following a fall from a tree at a friend's all-night party, while 19-year-old veterinary student Ashleigh is rushed into A&E after being involved in a high-speed head-on car crash. Elsewhere, Peter, 78, arrives at King's with abdominal pains, and as he receives treatment, he paints a picture of his eventful life

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Sean Lock and Kerry Godliman take on Jon Richardson and Joe Wilkinson in the comedy words and numbers quiz, while Mr Swallow - aka Nick Mohammed - joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. Hosted by Jimmy Carr with Rachel Riley looking after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Schoolboy Eddie, 12, is brought into A&E having been hit by a car on his way home from school, and doctors are concerned he may have suffered a bleed on the brain, as well as damage to his kidneys. Meanwhile, 64-year-old Linda, who breathes with the help of a tracheostomy, arrives at King's after experiencing respiratory failure at home, and student Amy, 20, has been coughing up blood

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Dorothy Pinkett wants a bolthole where she can escape to on her favourite island of Menorca. For the past seven years she has been caring for her husband, who is disabled after having a stroke. Owning a holiday home that can provide some respite for herself and his wonderful team of carers is really important, so the pressure is really on for Jasmine Harman to deliver the perfect property for her budget of £135,000

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: A selection of favourite investigations, including Jimmy Doherty heading to southern Italy to find out where the flavour comes from in his Earl Grey tea. Kate Quilton wants to know if it is true that oysters can be eaten all year round, or whether they should be avoided in the summer months, while Matt Tebbutt is in Cornwall to learn what gives clotted cream its distinctive yellow colour

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Florida's Gulf Coast is Sue Hyde and Ray Covelly's number one holiday destination, and now that they're engaged, it's where they want to buy their very first property and continue to enjoy everything the sunshine state has to offer. Scarlette Douglas shows them five attractive properties for their budget of £185,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: After falling in love with Fuerteventura's breathtaking scenery eight years earlier, Mandy and Peter have dreamt of swapping their island life in Jersey for the warmer climate of the Canaries. Armed with a budget of £127,000 Jasmine Harman shows them five properties on their budget of £127,000, hoping one will tick all their boxes

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas goes property-searching around Naples, one of the most stylish cities along Florida's Gulf Coast, for house-hunters Trever and Reiss, who have £350,000 to spend on a holiday home to invest in a home in the area

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two couples who were at very different stages in their lives. In 2016, Kirstie Allsopp searched around Warrington for childhood sweethearts Andy and Jen, who were ready to start a family. Back in 2017, Phil helped Kent converts Rich and Debs find a new home with a sea view. Now, Phil returns to find out if both couples are happy in their new homes

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Carpenter Wes Leaver hosts the first party in east Kent, hoping his science theme will be enough to win him the £1,000 prize at the end of the week. However, the 34-year-old faces competition from estate agent Alexandra Austin, beautician Emma Phillips, dog-lover Sally Parry and fancy-dress enthusiast Stephen Drew

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Estate agent Alexandra Austen hosts the second party of the week in east Kent, hoping to impress her guests with pan-European cuisine. However, the meal gets off to a shaky start when Sally Parry is forced to confront her fear of beans, while Stephen Drew struggles with a goat's cheese parcel. Alexandra's decision to serve veal also proves controversial, and it soon becomes clear two of the guests are not enjoying each other's company

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beautician Emma Phillips hosts the third dinner party in east Kent. Her main course is described by one diner as a pet on a plate, and Alexandra Austin declares the menu to be rather odd. Meanwhile, Stephen Drew and Wes Leaver enjoy an impromptu beauty treatment together

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dog-lover Sally Parry hosts the fourth dinner party in east Kent, hoping to impress her guests with a pink-themed night, including posh pink food and table decorations. However, Sally and Emma have a heated argument, Alex misbehaves and Wes falls asleep

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Flamboyant Stephen Drew hosts the final dinner party in east Kent, and has designed a menu that will allow him to spend time entertaining his guests. With an Absolutely Fabulous theme, a few of the diners are expecting a Mardi Gras vibe, but he has different ideas for the night - before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at The Cholmeley Arms in Burton-le-Coggles, Lincolnshire, run by chef John Berry and his wife Lesley. During a sausage-making competition, Hilary and Stacey from Tarr Farm get competitive. At dinner, Lesley reveals John's stroppy streak, and Joe and Louise up the ante for the next visit. The guests are blown away by breakfast but some of the feedback leaves Lesley and Steve wanting answers

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Islington Mill B&B in Salford, where Joe Spencer and Louise Woodcock have an alternative hosting style as their drag alter egos

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Third host Peter Morris welcomes guests to the Pebbles B&B in Seaton, Devon, but despite his breakfast award, not all of the guests are impressed by his culinary offerings

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the Tarr Farm Inn on Exmoor, where Hilary Lester and Stacey Wade are proud of their five-star standards. However, Peter is on the warpath after his feedback

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: It is the last day of the competition and there is tension in the air, as Cholmeley Arms hosts John and Lesley want to get to the bottom of Peter's comments

programme.title: Pamela Anderson's Family Home Renovation
programme.desc: The Hollywood star leaves her life behind and returns home to Vancouver Island, moving into her grandmother's six-acre legacy property with plans to renovate the old boathouse on the shoreline into a west coast masterpiece. Pamela and her team of designers, architects and contractors start with the small project of turning the unfinished basement into a laundry area, pantry and mudroom but before they can begin she has to figure out where to put her 600 pairs of shoes

programme.title: Amanda Owen's Farming Lives
programme.desc: Amanda visits SJ and Nat to learn about their lives as pig farmers on the Yorkshire/Lancashire border. She learns how to make artisan sausages and salami, and helps on opening day of the farm's new shop. Nat teaches Amanda how perfecting the breeds of pig requires years of dedication and takes her out to meet some of the shopkeepers their farm supplies

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Documentary following life inside one of Britain's busiest A&E departments at King's College Hospital in south London. It's Red Nose Day, but there's little to laugh about for 33-year-old Dilson, who is rushed in with knife wounds to his head and neck after being attacked outside a nightclub. Meanwhile, 79-year-old Doreen has broken her wrist in a fall at home, and parents Keeley and Michael are concerned by the fact their toddler Cydney hasn't urinated for two days

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Fifty-year-old mechanical engineer Graham is rushed into King's College Hospital in south London with a suspected heart attack, and after his brother reminisces about their carefree youth, the doctor suggests Graham's problems may be related to his more recent stressful lifestyle. Meanwhile, 71-year-old Pat is found unconscious by her husband, and 65-year-old Mick is discovered lying in the street with blood coming out of his ear. In both cases, the medics suspect brain haemorrhages, so scans are required

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Sean Lock and Harriet Kemsley take on Jon Richardson and Joe Lycett in the words-and-numbers game, while Mat Ewins joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. Hosted by Jimmy Carr, with Rachel Riley looking after the numbers and letters

programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the game show mash-up, with Rachel Riley and Susie Dent. Jon Richardson and Sara Pascoe take on Sean Lock and Richard Ayoade. Nick Helm joins Susie in Dictionary Corner

Meanwhile, 79-year-old Doreen has broken her wrist in a fall at home, and parents Keeley and Michael are concerned by the fact their toddler Cydney hasn't urinated for two days

Meanwhile, 71-year-old Pat is found unconscious by her husband, and 65-year-old Mick is discovered lying in the street with blood coming out of his ear. In both cases, the medics suspect brain haemorrhages, so scans are required

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jacqui Lockhart has worked hard all her life, and now that she has the savings available she wants to fulfil her lifelong dream of owning a holiday home on Spain's southern Costa Blanca. With a cash budget of £50,000 and the support of her daughter Judy, the pressure is on for Danni Menzies to help Jacqui secure her dream property

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets Cornish couple Rebecca and Damian, who are working to restore a luxury American trailer, and former taxi driver Caroline, who is building a writing den in her garden on a budget of just £800, using only recycled materials retrieved from the local dump. Plus, George's Spanish tour continues in Andalusia and a luxury mobile home provides inspiration for the big build

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: George visits Lucas and Hayley, whose bland and boxy 1970s four-bedroom home sticks out like a sore thumb among the period properties of Saffron Walden, Essex. To make matters worse, some 1980s interior additions have added insult to injury - and the double garage at the side is next to useless. Enter architect Chris Dyson to bring the property bang up to date. But will Lucas and Hayley be happy with his radical plans?

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George's continued renovation mission takes him to Moseley and Wheaton Aston in the West Midlands. He begins with a conversion to unite upstairs and downstairs flats in an Arts and Crafts building, although one of his suggestions leaves the owners speechless. He also visits an 18th-century pub that has fallen victim to some dodgy DIY - and quickly devises a clever plan to make the most of the period features

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Marlon Williams hosts the first party in Oxford, and hopes his love-island-themed evening will be enough to win him the £1,000 prize at the end of the week. However, after a shambolic start to proceedings, the night ends with the smashing of plates

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Inventor Richard Berrecloth hosts the second dinner party in Oxford, and hopes to impress his guests with home-made food and an unusual form of entertainment. However, Heidi Kelloway and Marlon Williams appear to be more interested in each other than their host's hospitality - while another diner seems rather too keen on sampling the wine

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mother-of-three Victoria Collett hosts the third dinner party in Oxford and begins the day with a hangover and a few culinary disasters. It is not long before her guests start grumbling and Richard Berrecloth criticises her seafood starter, so she pins her hopes on the Caribbean curry being a success

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dog trainer James Hearle hosts the fourth dinner party in Oxford, but his four-legged friends threaten to turn the evening into a mess. Tempers also rise between the guests as culinary critic Richard Berrecloth continues shocking the group with his brutal honesty

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Heidi Kelloway hosts the final dinner party in Oxford, determined to lighten the mood of the other diners. However, the evening turns sour when the diners confront the overly critical Richard Berrecloth about his frank comments, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Bridge Hotel in Scunthorpe, owned by Martin and Hannah Weaver. However, visitors Rob and Michelle from Seashells B&B find a condom by the entrance and Clare and Fran from The New Court Hotel are concerned about cleanliness. Tom and Samara from The Crown at Whitchurch think the rooms are little more than functional. Martin and Hannah try to impress their guests at breakfast by introducing them to their pet pig, but there are issues with eggs, but some harsh feedback disappoints the pair

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Seashells B&B in Sutton-on-Sea, where owners Michelle and Rob Earp hope their simple residence with an animal twist will win the day. Given Michelle and Rob criticised the Bridge Hotel, Martin and Hannah give their room a thorough going over and find all manner of issues. The self-service breakfast buffet receives some tough criticism in the morning, and Rob and Michelle are angry about their feedback

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to The Crown at Whitchurch in Herefordshire, where ex-army man Tom Jones runs the pub B&B with his step-daughter Samara Cohen

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the New Court Hotel in Usk, managed by Clare Davies, who faces complaints include peppery eggs and missing mushrooms at breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet to find out what they have been paid and to settle some scores after being offended by some of the feedback they have received

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Make-up artist Craig Alexander Wilson hosts the first party in Glasgow, hoping his edible glitter and sparklers will impress his fellow diners. However, his guests are less than overawed when he tries to guess their ages, hampering his chances of winning the £1,000 prize at the end of the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Paul Cowan hosts the second dinner party in Glasgow, but his penchant for practical jokes threatens to overshadow his menu, which includes steak Balmoral with whisky sauce and the enigmatically named Paul's Cream Puff

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris crosses Australia from south to north following the original ill-fated route of the 2,000 mile-long Adelaide to Darwin railway. After beginning his journey on a luxury modern train, he transfers to one of the line's surviving steam locomotives before hitting the Outback, where he quickly concludes that a 4x4 is a more practical means of travelling. He passes through ghost towns and explores abandoned railway relics before uncovering why most of the southern section of the line eventually had to be abandoned. At Alice Springs he hitches a ride on a freight train headed for Darwin and reaches his final destination after nearly 24 hours in the cramped cab

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris takes a trip through India on the Konkan railway, a line that opened in 1998 and runs down the west coast. He starts his journey at dawn in the country's financial capital Mumbai, where the Mandovi Express is the first of many trains he catches along the 472 miles of track running through the states of Maharashtra, Goa and Karnataka. To keep the line straight, 92 tunnels and 2,000 bridges had to be built in one of the wettest areas of the subcontinent and Chris joins the monsoon team, which patrols daily to ensure that it is free from obstructions

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring the remains of a pioneering industry town in Ohio, a once beautiful Croatian resort bombarded by enemy fire, and an otherworldly garden of Eden in Mexico

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of the Allied forces hunt for Joachim Peiper, the man responsible for the massacre of American PoWs in Malmedy, Belgium

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: How the Japanese air force dropped swarms of fleas on a Chinese city in a bid to infect the population with bubonic plague

programme.title: The Fred Dibnah Story
programme.desc: The life of the Bolton steeplejack, explaining how his TV career began and exploring his passion for steam engines. The opening episode sees him working on the spectacular demolition that would set him on the road to fame

programme.title: The Fred Dibnah Story
programme.desc: Fred gets his first taste of fame, but does not entirely welcome the limelight when it interrupts his work on the restoration of a wrecked steam tractor. The steeplejack is further annoyed when forced by his wife to take a holiday to Blackpool, but puts his time there to good use

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey from Newcastle to Melton Mowbray, stopping at historic Durham Cathedral. He also explores one of the first locomotives in Darlington, and takes a gothic Dracula-inspired tour of Whitby. Finally, he boards a steam train to travel across the North Yorkshire Moors

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo takes a Turkish bath in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, and explores the Victorian industrial village of Saltaire in West Yorkshire. He also meets alpacas, whose fleeces made a fortune in the age of George Bradshaw, as he journeys from Newcastle to Melton Mowbray in Leicestershire

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins the fourth leg of his journey from Derby to Lindisfarne in Middlesbrough, visiting one of the last iron foundries in the town and helping cast a carrot valve for a steam engine. His next stop is Darlington, Co Durham, where he meets the editor of the Northern Echo and finds out about the colourful history of WT Stead, one of his predecessors. Michael then heads to St Paul's monastery in Jarrow, Tyne and Wear, to learn about eighth-century monk the Venerable Bede, known as 'the father of English history', before finishing in Hexham, Northumberland, where he visits a historic ginger beer emporium

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off from Newcastle on the final leg of his journey from Derby to Lindisfarne, finding out about the world's earliest swing bridge and its inventor William Armstrong. He also travels by boat from the port of Seahouses to examine the story of lighthouse keeper's daughter Grace Darling, who, along with her father, rescued nine people from tumultuous seas in 1838. On the Holy Island of Lindisfarne, Michael explores the lime kilns and finds out how Christianity spread from here across northern England in the 7th century

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: During the Vietnam War an elite team of pilots braved terrifying odds by flying unarmed light aircraft over enemy troops to mark targets for America's supersonic strike planes. programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A real-life concrete jungle in America's 'Rust Belt', and an industrial facility that brought energy to a remote corner of the world

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his 1913 railway guide, Michael Portillo travels from the Swiss Alps to the shores of Lake Geneva. Along the way, he is caught up in a war zone with the Red Cross and rescued from an 'avalanche' by a St Bernard puppy. He takes to the skies in a vintage bi-plane to retrace the epic journey of the pioneering pilot who was first to fly over the Alps, and tries his hand at watchmaking, James Bond style

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo leaves Europe behind to take in the sights, smells and tastes of North Africa as he travels from the Mediterranean port of Tangier to the Berber city of Marrakech. At Asilah, the political commentator lends a hand with the construction of Morocco's new £3billion high-speed railway line to Casablanca, where he calls in to the most famous gin joint in the world

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from the Italian Riviera to the Austrian Alps, starting in Genoa, where he learns how an Edwardian Briton introduced football to the port. He takes the train as it clings to the cliffs along the Riviera Di Levanti to reach the picturesque and remote villages of the Cinque Terre, now a UNESCO World Heritage Site, before ending his journey in the famous Brenner Pass, the scene of a ground-breaking engineering project to build one of the world's longest rail tunnels

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo braves the freezing temperatures of the Baltic Sea and finds peace paddling a canoe on the Lakes of Finland. On his journey from the Latvian capital Riga to Tampere in Finland, he encounters medieval knights in Tallinn, grills sausages in Helsinki and samples cloudberry liqueur in a hot tub. He later arrives in Estonia, where in the setting of a ruined 13th-century cathedral he learns how the Baltic countries demonstrated their desire for independence from the Soviet Union with a 'singing revolution'

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo concludes his journey in the Netherlands, where he travels from Rotterdam to Utrecht, including a visit to the world's largest flower auction in Haarlem, a trip to Delft to learn how the city came to specialise in pottery and an exploration of the government buildings in The Hague

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ventures onto the European rail network to retrace journeys featured in Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide of 1913, beginning with London to Monte Carlo. His first stop is Paris, where he absorbs the atmosphere, before heading south to the Cote d'Azur and ending his journey at Monaco's gaming tables

programme.title: Australia with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Presenter Julia Bradbury travels 12,000km as she explores all four corners of Australia, finding out about the continent and the people who live there. She begins in Sydney, exploring the harbour and heading backstage at the famous opera house. At Bondi Beach she joins a shoreline patrol and visits a tattoo parlour, before she joins the local drag queens for a memorable night

programme.title: Australia with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Presenter Julia Bradbury continues her epic journey across Australia, exploring all four corners as she finds out about the continent and the people who live there. Her next step is the Blue Mountains, a rugged region in New South Wales. Along the way she has a go at paddle boarding with pooches, meets Australia's favourite koala and has a chat with fashion designer Jenny Kee. She also takes a ride on the world's steepest railway, and her hike through the mountains ends with a sighting of the bowerbird

programme.title: Australia with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia meets backpackers in Cairns and heads out to an island turtle sanctuary. She also treks through the oldest rainforest in the world and gets a taste for green ants. Finally, the caretakers of an idyllic island introduce her to the magic of the Great Barrier Reef

programme.title: Australia with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: The presenter continues her 12,000km journey across the continent with a tour of Western Australia. She meets some of the millionaire boat-builders and surfers in the city of Perth, then moves more than 2,000km north along the coast to Broome, where she enjoys a day at the races. Finally she ventures into the Outback to find out about life with an Aboriginal family

programme.title: Australia with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia continues her 12,000km journey across the continent with a tour of the Northern Territory. She embarks on a crocodile safari in the wetlands of the Northern Territory, before relaxing in Darwin, home of the Ghan train. She then hits the open road with a retiree who now travels the country - or as the Aussies call them 'grey nomads' - to discover life on one of Australia's vast cattle stations

programme.title: Australia with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia continues her 12,000km journey across the continent in Central Australia, a huge outback region of the Northern Territory also known as the Red Centre. She begins in the town of Alice Springs, where she is persuaded to take part in a dry boat race. She also heads back to the classroom at the world's largest school, meets a retired Aussie soap star at his desert home and takes a camel ride to the sacred site of Uluru, or Ayers Rock

programme.title: Australia with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia reaches South Australia as she continues her 12,000km journey across the continent. She drives along the Explorers Way, a route through the Outback mapped out by a pioneer in 1862, to the world's most isolated pub, where a small plane takes her on to the ancient landscape of the Painted Hills. In Adelaide, she climbs the roof of the Oval sports stadium and meets a women's cycling team, before ending her journey in wine country

programme.title: Australia with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: For the final leg of her journey around Australian journey, Julia drives along the Great Ocean Road toward Melbourne. Along the way she watches koalas while enjoying a cuppa, discovers a golf course where kangaroos share the links, paddles with platypuses and spots wombats at dusk

programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.title: Blandings
programme.desc: Period comedy based on the stories by PG Wodehouse, starring Timothy Spall as the befuddled Lord Emsworth - known to his friends as Clarence - and Jennifer Saunders as his indomitable sister Connie. The obnoxious Duke of Dunstable has come to stay, causing all manner of mayhem - but that turns out to be the least of Clarence's problems when he discovers his house guest has a dastardly plan to get him out of the way. Harry Enfield and Mathew Baynton guest star, with Tim Vine joining the cast as loyal butler Beach

programme.desc: An elderly Scottish clerk tries to sabotage the new methods introduced by an American efficiency expert reorganising the old-fashioned firm where he works. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers, Constance Cummings, Roddy McMillan, Robert Morley and Jameson Clark

programme.title: Above Us the Waves (1955)
programme.desc: A Royal Navy commander sets out to win his admiral's confidence by launching secret midget submarine raids on the formidable German battleship Tirpitz, which is hiding in the fjords of Norway. However, as time unfolds, the mission becomes increasingly perilous. Second World War drama based on a true story, starring John Mills, Donald Sinden, John Gregson and James Robertson Justice

programme.title: London Districts

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Christmas Day arrives and news of Jacob Marley's murder dampens the festivities, giving Inspector Bucket a new investigation to pursue. Meanwhile, at Satis House, Amelia Havisham's mysterious rescuer makes another appearance. Period drama, weaving together the back-stories of some of Dickens' various tales, starring Stephen Rea, Tuppence Middleton and Ben Starr

programme.title: Mistresses
programme.desc: Siobhan is racked by guilt after her liaison with Dominic and confesses all to Jessica, but when Hari reacts badly to news about his infertility she returns to work and the affair. Trudi is overcome by nerves on a date with Richard, Katie tries to persuade Sam to return to college, but is afraid he knows her secret, and Jessica gets tipsy with Alex while trying on outfits for the lesbian wedding

programme.title: An Englishman in New York
programme.desc: John Hurt reprises his role as Quentin Crisp in this sequel to The Naked Civil Servant, picking up his story where the 1975 drama about the eccentric Englishman left off. Crisp sets off on the journey of a lifetime to the Big Apple, where the Americans immediately embrace the openly gay writer and his waspish ways, and before long he is being wined and dined by celebrities in every corner of Manhattan. But, as is so often the case with Quentin, he cannot resist making outrageous comments, and an ill-considered quip about the growing Aids crisis sees him suddenly dropped from high society. Sex and the City's Cynthia Nixon co-stars as performance artist Penny Arcade, with Jonathan Tucker, Denis O'Hare and Swoosie Kurtz

programme.title: Mysterious Creatures (2006)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama, starring Timothy Spall and Brenda Blethyn as the parents of a woman with mental health difficulties. When their daughter's hostile behaviour and the authorities' lack of support become too much to handle, the couple decide to commit suicide together, writing a letter to a local newspaper to explain the reasons behind their actions. The cast also includes Rebekah Staton and Judy Flynn

programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes at the fashion and lifestyle magazine aimed at those people moving in the circles of Britain's high society, not only documenting, but also dictating the social calendar of Britain's ruling classes. The programme follows editor Kate Reardon and her features team as they put together an issue, attending shoots and key social events to meet the people featured in their pages, including the Earl of Glasgow at his 13th-century castle in North Ayrshire, and Nigerian millionaire Kola Karim, who has no idea how many cars he owns

programme.title: The Escape Artist
programme.desc: David Tennant stars in this drama as Will Burton, a highly talented junior barrister who is in great demand, having never lost a case, much to the frustration of his courtroom rival Maggie Gardner. programme.title: All Star Family Fortunes

programme.title: All Star Family Fortunes
programme.desc: Celebrity Big Brother winner Katie Price and actor Charlie Lawson, best known as Coronation Street's Jim McDonald, are joined by their families to answer a series of seemingly simple questions based on a survey of 100 members of the public. The winning team then goes on to the Big Money round, where a jackpot of £30,000 can be won for charity. Vernon Kay hosts the long-running game show

programme.title: Strike It Lucky
programme.desc: Michael Barrymore hosts the madcap game show, in which three teams of two prove seek to progress along a board game-style path by answering questions. Each duo are allowed to determine how many spaces they would like to move by answering the corresponding number of questions. Landing on a space reveals it's hidden contents, which could amount to a prize, or a 'hot spot', which causes contestants to forfeit their gathered winnings
